export.name: Qua Silverborn

The attribute bonus depends on the class using it.

+1

export.name: The Guidelines of Enchanting
export.description:
After speaking with a blacksmith more intimately, some of the secrets of blacksmithing were revealed to you.

Stacking Enchantments typically ${1000,orange}$ times the number of other enchantments squared due to the issues around keeping the other enchantments in place. For instance, a 2<sup>nd</sup> enchantment would likely cost ${4000,orange}$G extra, and a 3<sup>rd</sup> an extra ${9000,orange}$G, and so on.

+ After 2 Enchantments:
A D20 is rolled and on [Number of Enchantments] * 2 or lower, the item becomes inert and can no longer be enchanted.

ie. A short sword has an accuracy and a 1d4 cold enchantment and you go to add +1 damage. The enchantment will cost ~${2000,orange}$ additional gold to maintain the other enchantments and if a 4 or less is rolled, the item is disenchanted and inert. The blacksmith will also likely keep your money.

While you know all of this, it generally seems more a rule of thumb and there may be ways around it and in other cases, stronger enchantments that blacksmiths have less experience with may behave quite differently.

Typically, low level enchantments such as 1d6 of magical damage or resistance or basic additional accurracy average ${200,orange}$G, while more advanced versions, such as a 1d12 versions average around ${1000,orange}$G base.
export.note:
After 2 enchantments, almost always requires attunement. Some blacksmiths can skirt this and also adjust the enchantment costs.

Additionally, with stronger enchantments, the chance to go inert goes up triggering after 1 enchantment and with a multiplier of 3.

export.name: The Blacksmith of Tebit
export.description:
You've learned of Via Lantent, the blacksmith of Tebit.

Her skill is known in some circles for knowing more powerful enchantments and being very skilled with her forge.

She is however part of the Arcane Society, which you know at least is hard to gain access to.

export.name: Wayfarer Kingdom of Curell
export.description:
The City of Curell is considered a small kingdom by most, and thrives in the wilds despite the constant threat of wild beasts attacking.

It stays off the maps of many of the kingdoms despite its size, though few know why.

export.name: Artifact of Claruthano
export.description: Having learned that the artifacts are actually powerful scattered pieces of great blade, you've become aware that the grip of the blade is located on Claruthano.

export.name: Artifact of Druteta
export.description: The island of Druteta seems to contain the Pommel of the great artifact.

export.name: General Measurement Units
export.description:
Standard Single Units
1 Stud - Distance
1 Block - Weight
1 Brick - Volume


1 Mile: 2000 studs

export.name: Merpo The Hull Breacher
export.description: Merpo is a giant squid who stays near the surface bashing in the hulls of ships.

export.name: Myth of the Blade of Mist
export.description:
The myth of the Blade of Mists tells the tale of a blade that can manipulate water and obscured the bearer, letting them teleport great distances and consuming those who oppose them.

It is said to have been wielded by a great king and used to carve out the ancient kingdom of Deslusia, who's values were just.

But slowly, as the kingdom entered peace, unrest is said to have be set the king. Wars were declared against their allies and after years of combat, the king was slain and his blade disassembled.

To further their understanding of the great magic, the parts of the blade were scattered among the kingdoms that defeated the king.

The legend says that the pieces can be found and reassembled but cautions against wielding the blade, a tale of how power can consume you.
export.note:
The blade itself is actual good, but the king was corrupted by the church of Cthulu, whom at those times masqueraded as a church of good.

Cthulu also being the god that the great arch wizard who ended the world served.

The new Arch Wizard secretly serves Lucian instead and the church of Cthulu is supports him as the world will be easier to destroy with almost all life eradicated, however the church of Lucian  moved against the great wizard in the past, something that has not been forgotten.

export.name: The Ancient Kingdom of Desulsia
export.description:
The kingdom of Deslusia was created almost single handedly by the King Ervino while wielding the mythical Mist's Edge. Using its power to defeat those who would oppose him.

The kingdom fell after the king declared war after war before being at war with the world, and losing.

export.name: The Gold of Arcar
export.description: Guarded by a large Wyrm worshipped by the Kintari, Arcar was a great leader of the Kintari who hoarded gold and treasure. The Kintari themselves have little need for it and thought nothing of burying him with it, however they lightly defend the entrance to his tomb.
export.note: They have unlocked and taken everything from the dungeon but the crown but know that they need 2 green and 2 red crystals to complete the 2x2 floor pattern to be able to remove it.

export.name: The Kintari
export.description:
The Kintari are a large insect like race. They walk on all fours but the males can stand and wield basic weapons.

They seem to have limited intelligence, but have enough awareness to construct basic bridges and huts.

export.name: Insera
export.description: Insera is a large Wyrm, worshiped by the Kintari. She is known to breath fire as well as being able to travel vast distances.

export.name: Vatase Mountain Range
export.description: Little is known of the Vatase mountain range, few explorers have come back from here, with the only reports speaking of rocky crab like creatures.

export.name: Eastern Kintari Tribes of Sulendirida
export.description: You know of the eastern tribes of Kintari that occupy the stretch of the river Corbin.

export.name: The Ner
export.description: The Ner was Captain Orbec's boat. Only known to a few in the treasure hunting business.

export.name: Captain Orbec
export.description: Captain Orbec was a treasure hunter with whom Lan Pintiru worked.

export.name: Common Cleric Spells
export.description: You know of many spells commonly used by clerics.

export.description: This is the last campsite that Lan remembers where they had planned to return after their adventure.

The sea here is saturated by octopi that can cause rough seas.

export.name: Entel

Location of Wyrm guardian Entel.

He roams a 20 mile radius underground causing tremors.

export.name: Entel

Location of Wyrm guardian Entel.

export.description:
Abandoned campsite from the Draconian empire for mining magical stones.

It was abandoned after being overrun by creatures of the island.

export.description: You know of an artifact in Sulendirida somewhere to the north eastern part of the island.
export.note: This is the blade, found in the tomb of Aixer.

export.name: Artifact of Vatnunda
export.description: You know of an artifact in Vatnunda somewhere to the middle of the eastern coast of the island.
export.note: This is the hilt. Found in the Academy's library lab.

export.name: Raven's Nest
export.description: The Raven's Nest.

export.name: Wizard Familiars
export.description:
You know of the common familiars that a wizard can call from the aether.

The stats for the familiar will vary slightly depending on the type that is called forth.

export.name: Gisengards
export.description:
Gisengard's have enchanted scales that grant make them very difficult to kill and very desirable.

Every so often, the properties of a Gisengard change, shifting through flame, ice, or divine energy. The glow of their scales can give away what the alignment the creature is, however the glow is not always obvious.

Despite the scale's properties, once killed, only a few scales retain their properties if any.

Once spotted by a Gisengard, there's a chance they will try to attack you, but it isn't likely.

export.name: The Assassin Cis Mexel
export.description:
Cis Mexel was an assassin for the Thieves' Guild, but now they want him dead.

Thanks to Ontes, you know that Cis is a fan of strawberries as well.

export.name: City of Obhele
export.description: The city of Obhele is the routing center for the world's parcels. Otherwise a simple town, but has high levels of security around the docks.

export.name: Simple Freight
export.description:
Somincael managed to arrange a basic shipping network to get packages around with some simplicity for large organizations. Simply leaving a package with a dock office and a label indicating the organization will get it to that organizations office.

The routing for this however is quite tedious. As no nation fully trusts the other, all packages go through the city of Obhele.

export.name: The Arcane Society
export.description:
Based out of ${"content":"Tebit","class":"rs-orange"}$, the society is joined by the the leading researchers of the arcane arts and its history.

Under ${"content":"Leoterran","class":"rs-orange"}$ rule, the society manages to operate mostly independently but has arrangements with other nations and empires to operate in certain cities with varying degrees of oversight.

export.name: Rogue Expertise
export.description: You know what you need to do to develop your skills in certain areas beyond the usual proficiency.

export.name: The Gods
export.description:
You know of the common gods of the realm, beings of power who are known only by legends and the power their strongest followers call forth.

And while you know of these few, you have seen acts claimed to others whose names you know not.

export.name: The Crazy Ranger
export.description:
Guinness informed you of an old mate of his, a Galvin Broadshore. A strange name for a strange fellow, you know he can speak and read the language of the ancients and that Guiness swears it drove him mad.

Guiness mentioned he last saw him out on the continent of Colligus.

export.name: Cardinal's Nest
export.description: The Cardinal's Nest.

export.name: The Mace Sorarusaru
export.description: The Mace referred to as Sorarusaru is a dream carrier. A special mace imbued with arcane energy that makes the creature wielding it more powerful, but also causes them to vividly remember their dreams from the following night with such clarity that it can effect them throughout the day.

export.name: Church Caelillt
export.description:
The church has a long history of being haunted but has always been Caelillt.

And while the air always seems uneasy, the city formed around this temple, and the Alucavous Esplanade was constructed by the servant within Caelillt.

They serve Zeus, and lightning adorns many of the signs.

export.name: Alucavous Esplanade
export.description:
This level park resides outside the Church Caelillt.

Constructed by the church's servants, the land is considered holy by the citizens.

export.name: Rock Crabs of Sulendirida
export.description:
The Rock Crabs of Sulendirida seem to have an odd cycle, with the colors of the crystals they bare seeming to have some symbolic sense of purpose and a cycle of life carving through the mountains and eating the rocks.

Deep within the caves, a semi-peaceful wyrm seems to float in impossible pools, consuming the crystals from dying Rock Crabs.

These are not known to any explorers in Draconia.
export.note:
-- Red Crabs --
The "Curators". Protect the entrances and watch over

-- Blue Crabs --
Handle the day to day, the "Citizens"

-- Green Crabs --
Create the tunnels, the "Crafters"

export.name: Insera (Deprecated)
export.description: Insera is a large Wyrm, worshiped by the Kintari. She is known to breath fire as well as being able to travel vast distances.
export.note:
alucinor (Dream:Common)
pravus (Evil:Common)

The land is actually desecrated but masked by strong magic (DC:30 to perceive, DC:30 for non-religion, DC:25 for religious).

While seemingly safe, many of the church's servants kidnap and kill innocents here as sacrifice to Cthulu to keep his blessings.

export.name: City of Peum
export.description:
Peum is a religious city founded around the Church Caelillt, which has reside there for several centuries.

Over the last few decades it has grown quite a bit, many giving thanks to Ixeba Ratabu for its growth and his political sway to convince people to come.

Another is the beautiful Alucavous Esplanade, that offers a protected beautiful park to stroll through.

It's remote location and semi-isolationist stance on many political topics has made it an ideal refuge for those who wish to avoid the outside world.
export.note: This city also serves as the main perch for Cthulu in the world. While diminished from the apocalypse millennia ago, his followers have kept him strong here through rituals and sacrifice and a great deal of magical showmanship to hide it all.

export.name: City of Ascaqua
export.description:
A coastal town that serves as a military research base, but only recently. This small town used to be much smaller and served for some trade to Draconia by way of merchants who manage to trade with Nautregno and Draconia.

However, the coast line and the low wildlife activity in the area made it ideal for nobles to create summer get away homes, quickly followed by the military to keep the nobeles safe.
export.note:
Pirates in Ascaqua are trying to haul off a gold crystal that is hidden in the arcane society secret house
This is to power a portal in Colligus
When found, the pirates are moving the crates and the floor is littered with spikes, moving at full speed causes 1d4 piercing damage for every 4 studs covered at full speed. Moving even 1stud incurs the damage, but another 3 studs can move
Gold crystal starts out at the back
Initiative starts immediately with the boat in the back
Players can attempt to rush for the boat while the pirate guards engage
“Our boss will be very angry if we don’t get these to him. Sucks to be you”

export.name: City of Picio
export.description: The city of Picio is a Holy city to the God Serinal. However it has only been so for the last few decades. Prior to that, the city served as a major port city for trade with Nautregno and exploration of the nearby seas.

export.name: Language of the Ancients
export.description:
The ancient language is less of a language and more of a complex expression using several languages at once.

Basic reading of Ancient requires the knowledge of 4 separate languages at once:
+ Draconic
+ Deep Speech
+ Primordial
+ Celestial

With these, the tet can be understood, but not read. To read it fully, you must also understand Sylvan.

export.name: Peilac Lake
export.description: Named for the density of fish in the lake, it is unusually deep and no one in known record has reached the bottom of the lake, but for it's known history, it's simply been full of fish, making it a popular location for carnivores.
export.note:
+ peix (Draconic:Fish)
+ llac (Draconic:Lake)

export.name: City of Simer
export.description:
Recognizing the density of fish living in lake ${"content":"Peilac","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, ${"content":"Draconia","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ sent a large army to secure a city on the coast for procuring fish.

The city is constantly beset by beasts, but not out of hunger but fighting for territory, as such the beasts attacking tend to be larger the usual in size, leading the city to have large defenses.

If exploring around the city, officials recommended running away as in the case of larger creatures as they can be very territorial. If attacked, usually you simply need to get out of their territory.
export.note:
Simer is considered a “Gate City” that sits on a magical weakening with this realm and an unknown spirit realm.

+ Is the target of the arch mage to invade draconia, though the execution is weak

+ Mind controls cis mexel after he is sent on an assination message for an alcolyte

> The acolyte is the one controlling him and having trouble controlling the energies

> Color puzzle to unalign the gems, combination changes change what monster comes out

> Completely opposite colors close the portals

export.name: Combat Cover
export.description:
Walls, trees, creatures, and other obstacles can provide cover during combat, making a target more difficult to harm. A target can benefit from cover only when an attack or other effect originates on the opposite side of the cover. 
There are three degrees of cover. If a target is behind multiple sources of cover, only the most protective degree of cover applies; the degrees aren't added together. For example, if a target is behind a creature that gives half cover and a tree trunk that gives three-quarters cover, the target has three-quarters cover. 
A target with half cover has a +2 bonus to AC and Dexterity saving throws. A target has half cover if an obstacle blocks at least half of its body. The obstacle might be a low wall, a large piece of furniture, a narrow tree trunk, or a creature, whether that creature is an enemy or a friend. 
A target with three-quarters cover has a +5 bonus to AC and Dexterity saving throws. A target has three-quarters cover if about three-quarters of it is covered by an obstacle. The obstacle might be a portcullis, an arrow slit, or a thick tree trunk. 
A target with total cover can't be targeted directly by an attack or a spell, although some spells can reach such a target by including it in an area of effect. A target has total cover if it is completely concealed by an obstacle.

export.name: City of Uliersa
export.description:
The city of Uliersa is essentially devoted to the study of magic.

Centered around the temple of Òlibailumbo, it is mostly inhabited by wizards and scholars.

export.name: Basic Training at Òlibailumbo
export.description: You've spent a few days at the temple Òlibailumbo and learned of a few tricks that you can slowly master on your own.

export.name: Legend of the Veldýr (dep)
export.description:
Veldýr are large magical cats that stalk deep in jungles. They are known for being almost entirely black with a few gray spots, but a few have reported seeing similar beasts but all white in snow laden areas.

While many report being able to openly see one without being attacked, it is believed that the attacks that are reported are from groups stumbling into hunting grounds. In almost all cases, those reporting the attack are not the ones who were attacked.

Those few who have managed to subdue a Veldýr have been tight lipped about how or what happened and as such the legends that have spread paint the beasts as unkillable, as though they can be pushed out from an area, but  never killed. The truth to these rumors is unknown to most.
export.note:
Veldýr can be killed, but leave no corpse. Instead, a small idol is left.

When the idol is possessed, the holder rolls a percentile every morning to determine if the Veldýr's spirit is feeling loyal today or not.

As successful rolls occur, the beast becomes easier to tame until it reaches 100% and then simply exists and is no longer an idol.

While the idol is held, it is impossible to find another Veldýr as they run away from the area, and even once loyal, the beast drives others away.

Before being tames, the beast has 1 legendary action and can have a lair with which it can trigger basic traps or symbiotic relationships.

Once tamed, it acts as a normal beast pet.

When only tamed as an idol, it reverts to an indestructible idol if combat occurs.

The idol has only 3 uses per day.

The beast has a move speed of 40 studs , and refuses to move if it has too much weight.

Will always refuse to be a beast of burden.

As it builds trust, also begins to act like a house cat.

export.name: City of Neulus Re
export.description:
Founded by Rele Mura to help feed the empire of Draconia and ensure that there is enough food for all the people of the Empire and not just the larger cities. 

Created only recently, a small troop helped carve out and now defends the city that is beset on almost all sides by wild beasts that seek to eat the townsfolk. But despite this struggle, the town manages to survive and bring in trade to help sustain life.
export.note:
The beer fridge holds a disruptive hint of divine energy from holding the Gisengard for Raven, slowly resulting in discontent in the town.

+ Not all beer requires refrigeration, Mquasi [imported] and one other

+ But Neulus Re doesn’t have trade with other beer routes yet, so working on it (possible quest)

export.name: Arcane Society Ascaqua Station
export.description: The Arcane Society has a small station in Ascaqua that tries to fly under the radar of the Draconian Intelligence, though the Arcane Society does openly trade and converse with Draconia all over Calokula, Ascaqua serves almost as a refuge for its members.
export.note:
Has a collection of 3 silver crystals and a single gold found from around Calokula of varying quality. 2 silvers are power crystal quality, the third is tainted by a few other crystals within it (red, orange) and they struggle when arcane energy is applied to the crystal, slowly cracking and it sits in an containment sphere.

Pirates are trying to find the building to get the gold crystal for the arcane wizard.

Also ha

export.name: Anongo's Smithing and Tool Shop
export.description: The main blacksmith of Ascaqua, it is a decent smithery and generally has a few assistants or students around to help Stinta around the forge and with general sales and shipping.
export.note: Simple Smithery

export.name: Lisola's Bottles and Bygones
export.description: A large potion shop in the city.

export.name: General Bloody Wares
export.description: A large general store in town

export.name: Pirate Hideout
export.description: A seemingly ambiguous tavern in Ascaqua appears to be a fortified pirate hideout.
export.note:
Investigation DC:17 when searching for them

DC:23 to find it accidentally with investigation.

Otherwise acts as a tavern that isn't taking anyone in with a seemingly normal lobby most of the time.

Has a basement that is reached by a back room on the second floor.

Trapdoor Investigation DC: 17 on general.

DC: 12 when looking for a trapdoor.

export.name: Omali Burin
export.description: Known for her greed and violence.

export.description: After scrounging through the libraries, you found the lightning bolt spell.

export.name: Researched: Sending
export.description: After scrounging through the libraries, you found the sending spell.

export.name: The Hungsungar Quarter
export.description: The Hungsungar Quarter is a special district in Simer devoted to studying the beasts in the area and the magic that seems to be effecting the area.
export.note:
Is reasonably certain the city sits on a special schism between 2 planes of existence but hasn't been able to ascertain that yet.

Will want help with acquiring samples or specimen.

The fire plane will be linked by Cis.

export.name: Allu's Smithing Works
export.description: A one woman show, she keeps her smithery running all day and all night, keeping odd hours of business, but known for her quality.

export.name: Ma Uma's Tap
export.description:
Ma Uma's Tap is the local bar.

Due to rough trade routes, beer drinks are pretty expensive, but Simer likes to drink.

export.name: Crystal Color Alignment
export.description:
Gleamed from an encyclopedia, you know recognize this as being the color alignments for the crystals.

![Crystal Color Wheel](/images/colorwheel-scaled.png)

export.description: Arcane shop that sells magical items and arcane fixings.

The common bone wolf is generally found around farms where normal wolves may be found.

These creatures seem to sometimes have magical properties, but ore otherwise just oddly formed aggressive wolves in nature.

export.name: City of Bantiacer
export.description: The city of Bantiacer is rarely traveled to but known to you.

export.name: City of No Coelevo
export.description: No Coelevo is a coastal port city that exists to help protect the bay where Montis lies.

export.name: City of Cotens
export.description: A military city serving the northern area of Leoterra. Smaller in manning but active with the threats of magical beasts and invaders alike.

export.name: City of Rica Nix
export.description: A lake city known for its fishing and fisheries, though the lake Usihaf is a delicate balance having lost its connection to the oceans of Somnicael.

export.name: Lake Usihaf
export.description:
Usihaf is the water remnants of a once larger lake, possibly joined with the ocean. The history only reveals itself with the life present in the lake despite the lack of a connection to the ocean.

Exploration has shown the lake to have a completely solid bottom but be inhabited by several large water worms that Leoterrians protect and keep fed, resulting in a delicate ecosystem in the lake and the fisheries of Rica Nix.

export.name: City of Fimus
export.description: The city of Fimus is against the lake Umerijo but its fishing is only a small part of its food source, however it's lack of walls for the general city is a passing issue with the wild life.

export.name: City of Flucris
export.description: Flucris is a small city managing the entrance of a river into the continent.

export.name: City of Oblidiumba
export.description: Oblidiumba is a remote city on a raised plateau next to Naka. A dense forest surrounds its base and a windy path extends up to it.

export.name: Bone Armor
export.description: You have learned the spell "Bone Armor"

export.name: Myth of the Soul Gem
export.description:
The myth around soul gems is that they were created by the last dark arch mage to attain immortality and that every gem is cursed to bring an evil fate to the one anywho holds one.

As a result, selling a soul gem is a difficult task.

export.name: Truth of the Soul Gem
export.description:
Soul Gems are forged from power crystals that are created with the sacrifice of several creature's souls.

The number of souls needed to attain a soul gem in the process varies by the size of the creatures sacrificed, but the size of the gem is always the same.

They appear as violet gems, smaller than power crystals and seem to be a condensed form of the crystals with specialized power.

The creatures sacrificed to the gem seem lost forever, unable to be resurrected by any means, including another soul gem. But a freshly killed creature can have its soul trapped inside a gem, and a skilled arcanist can simply pull the soul from a living creature with the gem alone, though in this case it is merely a flick of the wrist to return the soul to its body as long as the body hasn't rotted completely.

export.name: Spell: Misty Step
export.description: You have learned the spell Misty Step

export.name: Fall of Terdorolu
export.description:
Terdorolu was a coastal city of Leoterra that was destroyed by fire elementals.

You know that the person who opened the portal was a one "Isipha Ilarika" who was a seemingly peaceful girl who suddenly turned, though you don't know much beyond that.

With Terdorolu destroyed, the western side of Leoterra is now very vulnerable to attack.

export.name: Quest for the Thieve's Guild
export.description: Onte's has asked you to deliver a crate to Tebit for him.
export.note: Turned in on Borgevum 2, 318

export.name: Sinda of the Arcane Society
export.description:
Asked you to get a veldyr statue and clear the northern bone wolves.

Also pointed you toward the AIS library for research.

export.name: Spell: Revivify
export.description: You have learned Revivify

export.name: Via's Smithery
export.description: You know of Via's Smithery in Tebit for custom blacksmithing requests and higher quality weaponry.

export.name: Spell: Moonbeam
export.description: You have learned the spell Moonbeam

export.name: Paladin Fighting Styles
export.description:
In your training as a Paladin, you learned of several styles that can improve your effectiveness in battle.

Choose 1 of the 4 styles when you reach level 2 as a Paladin.

export.name: Goliath Training
export.description: You have trained with Goliaths and they have imparted their strength onto you.

export.name: Ethereal Plane
export.description:
The Ethereal Plane is adjacent to the Material Plane and the other Primal Planes, and serves as a transitional plane to other planes to and from the material plane.

In the Ethereal Plane, you can see the Material plane in shades of gray subject to light in the material plane, however you can simply pass through any constructed obstacles. Natural obstacles, such as trees and the ground beneath you, exist as solid objects in the Ethereal Plane and obstruct movement.

export.name: Fire Plane
export.description:
The Fire Plane is a Primordial Plane that is largely filled with elemental entities of the fire type.

Due to it's chaotic and hot nature, the realm is filled with lava and fire as well as hard, pressure formed rock.

Gems are not uncommon in this plane, and what few cities there are, are managed by intelligent and cunning elemental beings.

export.name: Great Worms: Known Beans
export.description:
The great worms have various ways of dealing with the things they consume while moving, and one of those "by-products" are referred to as beans.

While little is known about how the beans come to be aside from originating from the great worms, it is believed that they are a by-product of the worms consuming power crystals, or their fragments, inside the earth or their food.

The beans can have a wide variety of effects and only a few have been tested well enough for us to know what they do.

Those some other beans are known colloquial, the details of the bean itself are not.

export.name: Druidic Spells: Level 1
export.description: As a druid, your connection to nature grants you innate knowledge of a number of magical spells.

export.name: Bardic Spells: Level 1
export.description: You've learned a number of spells as a Bard...

export.name: Character Backgrounds
export.description: Most people come from a wide variety of backgrounds.

export.name: Languages of the World
export.description: The common languages of the world

export.description: As a Dwarf, you know the history of the gnomes and the different cultures there-in.

export.name: Elvish Heritage
export.description: As an Elf, you know the history of the gnomes and the different cultures there-in.

export.name: Halfling Heritage
export.description: As a Halfling, you know the history of the gnomes and the different cultures there-in.

export.name: The Relocation of Istond
export.description: Cadanti has disclosed that they were hired, through various third parties in the city of Curell in Colligus, to move the Great Worm Istond to Mikillabellera to protect the lake Conkosjo from the Leoterran armies.

export.name: Location of a Great Wyrm
export.description: A Great Worm is located here

export.name: The Fall of Terdorolu
export.description: The city of Terdorolu was felled by a horde of Fire Elements that was seemingly called forth by a Isipha while under some kind of mind control spell.

export.name: Isipha Ilarika
export.description:
Isipha Ilarika was a teacher in Terdorolu shortly before the city fell to fire elementals.

She seems to have been subjected to some kind of mind control that has displaced her soul from her body, leaving her somewhere in the [Ethereal Plane](:::/knowledge?id=knowledge:plane:ethereal).

export.name: Robrust Aein
export.description:
Robrust Aein used to serve in the Leoterran army and retired to a simple life in Terodorlu helping protect civilians from minor crimes and wild life, serving as a make shift sheriff in the large city.

As the city fell, he protected many citizens and helped escort a few to safety before helping the to subdue his friend Isipha and get her to Montis, the capital of Leoterra, for treatment.

He now stands by her side in Montis, awaiting the Draconian group called Raven to return from their quest to find a way to the [Ethereal Plane](:::/knowledge?id=knowledge:plane:ethereal) to search for Isipha's soul.

export.name: Training: Great Weapon Master
export.description: You have training in the use of the Great Weapon Master Feat

export.name: Spell: Divination
export.description: You've learned the spell Divination

export.name: The Arcane Power Spectrum
export.description: ![The Power Spectrum](/images/dnd/color_alignment_v_small.png)

export.name: Nature of the Crystals of Power
export.description:
The Power Crystals are elements of nature that form from raw arcane energy in the world, collecting in the ground and gathering like any other crystal.

Each color has its own properties and quirks and has earned itself a name:
+ The Citizen - Blue
+ The Crafter - Green
+ The Composer - Orange
+ The Curator - Red

And while generally part of the [Power Spectrum](:::/knowledge?id=story:crystals:powerspectrum) of the represented colors, the Lime behaves differently, seeming to behave like any of the other crystals with the right arcane knowledge earning it the title of "The Conformist".
export.note:
+ The Conformist - Lime
+ The Creator - Gold
+ The Champion - Silver

export.name: Follower of Dionysus
Spell: Iceball
export.description: You've learned the spell Ice Ball

export.name: Rare Book in Hwand
export.description:
A rare book with a gold and silver cover is known to be somewhere in the ruins of ${"content":"Hwand","class":"rs-orange"}$ on the continent of ${"content":"Sulendirida","class":"rs-orange"}$.

${"content":"Lemuli Sourvo","class":"rs-orange"}$ in ${"content":"Dranous","class":"rs-orange"}$ asked to have the book retrieved and brought to him in exchange for a ${"content":"Ring of Wizardry","class":"rs-orange"}$ and to have another ring made, though it would still have to be purchased.

export.name: Pirates of Colligus
export.description:
${"content":"Lar","class":"rs-orange"}$ mentioned pirates in ${"content":"Colligus","class":"rs-orange"}$ as a possible starting point for hunting down the ${"content":"Red Lady","class":"rs-orange"}$.

He also mentioned there is some city known to be on the continent that is composed of lost wanderers who have gathered to establish a kind of outpost.

export.name: Spell: Heat Metal
export.description: You've learned the spell ${"content":"Heat Metal","class":"rs-orange"}$.

export.name: Ilerar's Stash
export.description: Ilerar "The Blade" Forit is a notorious pirate of the Maejuri Sea and is believed to have a stash of treasure on the continent of Colligus.

export.name: Holer's Civvies
export.description:
A popular place for the more well-to-do to order custom clothing, a select few actually come out to make their own purchases.

In the city however, the place is well known for well made clothing.
