export.name: Sicrinsian
export.description:
The Sicrinsian is a special flower used in enchanting that is a special ingredient you know is used by ${"content":"Via","class":"rs-orange"}$.

Notable for its Red and Pink petals, it is commonly found in the small forest of ${"content":"Antic Forest","class":"rs-orange"}$ in Tebit.

export.name: Account of the Assassin in Dranous
export.description: You've managed to learn of whom the assassin seems to be; A half-elf answering to the name "Iryna" with a notably large black and shadowy crossbow on her back.

export.name: Assassin in Dranous
export.description: You've learned that there's an assassin working in the city of ${"content":"Dranous","class":"rs-orange"}$ that seems to be going after ${"content":"Imperial Librarians","class":"rs-orange"}$.

export.name: Guild Assassin in Dranous Objective
export.description: Iryna's objective appears to be the librarians of the ${"content":"Imperial Library","class":"rs-orange"}$.

export.name: Travels: Tebit and the Arcane Society's Library
export.description:
After traveling around the continent of ${Mikillabellera,darkorange}$, they reached the island city of ${Tebit,darkorange}$.

Upon landing, turned in a crate from ${Ontes,darkorange}$ after using the code word "Umoya" to establish contact, never knowing what was in the crate.

After dropping off the crate, shopping ensued and negotiations with ${Via, darkorange}$ led to ${Natty,darkorange}$ and ${Xylaris,darkorange}$ going off in search of 3 ${Sicrinsian,darkorange}$ flowers in the ${"content":"Antic Forest","class":"rs-orange"}$ for Via to perform some enchantments for them while ${Torrin,darkorange}$ and ${Orla,darkorange}$ set off to try to join the Aracne Society.

While there however, ${Torrin,darkorange}$ stumbled across several books on the Arcane essence of the Power Crystals and the History of the Ancient Artifact known as ${The Blade of the Mist,darkorange}$. n trying to grab one, his intelligence immediately fell to 0 and on talking to the librarian there he mentioned that Raven had possession of a piece of the artifact and was told that would be of great interest to the Arcane Society and was sent to talk to some other researchers about this.

He met with ${Bina Laviso}$, a researcher who took over for ${Shinda,darkorange}$ (Who had tried to steal his Veldyr statue) and learned that there was a secret society within the Arcane Society seeking power who would abuse the artifact and said they must leave at once.

Running back to the boat with Orla in tow, everyone else was called back to the boat by Po using Sending and the group set off back to Dranous.

On arrivial, they sought out ${Lar,darkorange}$ and informed him of everything that had happened with the artifact and he informed them of ${Sa Brac,darkorange}$, the city where Draconia refines power crystals and riected them to get what they need from there without anyone learning of their pressence should they need anything to help hide the artifact and informed them that Nuatrengo likely has another part of the blade on the southern tip of ${Lurus}$.

export.name: Travels: SaBrac and the Crystal Factory
export.description:
After speaking with ${Lar,darkorange}$, the decision was made to go to SaBrac to acquire more crystals from the Draconian refinery there that sits on the coastline.

Once in the town, the group set out to the bar for information and learned of a broken door on the side and ${Xylaris,darkorange}$  caught 2 pickpockets stealing from someone in the bar. Though, notably, ${Natty,darkorange}$ makes a name for herself jumping on the bartender.

With information but the door, ${Norwind,darkorange}$ and ${Xylaris,darkorange}$ set out to investigate the door and stumbled across a large intimidating presence leaving the door.

${Norwind,darkorange}$ followed the figure to the cliffs where it simply walked off the cliff and into the water around 100 feet below, and after careful observation, the figure never appeared to surface.

${Xylaris,darkorange}$ snuck into the factory in search of some information and found dozens dead and stuffed into a room. On looking further she got distracted and trapped in a room as workers in the factory searched for what happened. On sneaking out, she caught the attention of one of the workers and ran off, losing him with an illusionary spell as a temporary distraction before meeting up with ${Norwind,darkorange}$ and going back to see what the group was up to in the room ${Norwind,darkorange}$ got.

They found the rest of the group asleep in the room, and woke them all to tell them about the giant figure. After a sleepy bit of arguing, items are found to be missing and it seems they've been robbed in the night, and after assessing the situation head back to the boat to sleep.

On waking up, the town has a small group of soldiers patrolling the city and on speaking to the learn that around 150 people had been killed in the small part of the factory where they found the bodies and that the only ${"content":"Orange Crystals","class":"rs-orange"}$ in the factory had been stolen. And after some brief inquiry, learned that the factory is commanded by ${"content":"General Sanquist","class":"rs-orange"}$ and that he loves Turkey Legs, a bit rare in the area.

${Natty,darkorange}$ and ${Orla,darkorange}$ explored the factory with their soldier escort and learned of off the book shipments from the factory to the Arcane Society and explored the Barracks under the factory and found a few closed off stairwells that went further below but had been sealed due to instability in the caves below.

${Xylaris,darkorange}$ found the pickpockets and followed them for a few hours, finding them making deals in back alleys and selling some of their stuff that had been stolen the night before. And after following them a bit more, caught them arguing over a small impromptu stash on the edge of the city where she found a ${"content":"Red Crystal","class":"rs-orange"}$ and a ${"content":"Blue Crystal","class":"rs-orange"}$, but didn't see the missing  ${"content":"Orange Crystal","class":"rs-orange"}$.

${Norwind,darkorange}$ & ${Torrin,darkorange}$ managed to procure shipping rights to the coastal town of ${Ascaqua,darkorange}$ that had recently been all but destroyed in what has been learned to be a malicious force seeking ${"content":"Soul Stones","class":"rs-orange"}$. After leaving, they managed a decent forgery of the ${Ascaqua's,darkorange}$ request slip and managed to get 3 ${"content":"Green Crystal","class":"rs-orange"}$s, 1 more than the original request, but still short an ${"content":"Orange Crystal","class":"rs-orange"}$ which the city needed to help with rebuilding.

When asking for the crystals, a ${Jim,darkorange}$ introduced himself and not-so-subtly slipped "Umoya" into his greeting, a word used when dropping off crates for the ${"content":"Thieve's Guild","class":"rs-orange"}$ in Tebit at the request of ${Ontes,darkorange}$ while in ${Dranous,darkorange}$. After a normal greeting and a brief pause, ${Jim,darkorange}$ returned to work, but it seemed he saw through the unusually change to the crystal shipment and likely suspected that they were with the ${"content":"Thieves Guild","class":"rs-orange"}$, backing off when he realized that he was incorrect.   

Last seen, ${Torrin,darkorange}$ was delivering the retrieved crystals to the boat with their permission to leave the secured harbor as ${Natty,darkorange}$ and ${Norwind,darkorange}$ lead ${Jim,darkorange}$ to the bar to retrieve their forged note that he was tasked with taking to ${"content":"General Sanquist","class":"rs-orange"}$ in the morning to figure out where the additional crystals were to come from.

export.name: Mysterious Figure's Dive
export.description:
This is where the large mysterious figure dove into the water and never surfaced.

(In the City of SaBrac on the South Eastern tip of Calukula)

export.name: Travels: Ilerar's Pirate Stash
export.description:
In the search for pirates on the continent of ${Colligus,darkorange}$, a ranger ambushed everyone with several panthers and after losing her companions, retreated into the jungle. Attempting to follow her lead to the ${"content":"Cil Mountain Range","class":"rs-orange"}$.

On inspection, a hidden cave was found after a figure ventured along the mountain with a torch in the night, seemingly leaving the hidden location or some place near by. On venturing into the cave, a note left for the hunter attempting to indicate some form of peace under the assumption that the hunter was following them.

On entering the cave, a dark erie cave ventured down into the side of the mountain and was found to be filled with traps.

Of the initial fork in the cave, the right side was explored and found to have a stash of treasure belonging to the pirate ${Ilerar,darkorange}$ and his ledgar was found deep within holding information on spending and revealing a connection with the ${"content":"Red Woman","class":"rs-orange"}$ and that this pirate helped her escape ${Ascaqua,darkorange}$, avoiding ${Cravous's,darkorange}$ patrols that were searching for her.

Further exploration revealed several trapped stores of goods in hallways off from his main room and an impressive ${"content":"Alchemy Laboratory","class":"rs-orange"}$ in one that proved difficult to reach.

Last seen, the group was camping in the hallway to this laboratory, getting some much needed rest to reach the impressively equipped room.

export.name: Illivan Medenia (Po)
export.description:
You knew Illivan Medenia as "Po" before he revealed his history to you and his name, revealing his experience with the power of a name and his desire to keep his secret.

Illivan is a powerful wizard who has retired in his age of 158 years, intricate magics extending his age in ways no one else really knows.

Additionally saved ${Adara,darkorange}$ who used to be a contract assassin, who later joined him in pursuit of protecting Draconia in the Draconian Special Forces.

export.name: Erenia Ambulo (Anna)
export.description:
Born in the Draconian Embassy on the continent of ${Coneixager,darkorange}$, she quickly took to traveling, finding the first vessel that would let her serve.

She quickly learned the stars, finding the sky fascinating as she traveled, but over time came to find the common sailor rather annoying. After traveling to Draconia, she was quickly recruited by ${Illivan,darkorange}$ to help him with a special mission. After performing admirabily, she happily joined him and ${Adara,darkorange}$.

export.name: Adara Inyoka (Vo)
export.description:
A very skilled assassin that joined with ${Illivan,darkorange}$ after he saved her life, joining the Draconian Special Forces with him, using both of their skills.

She generally keeps to herself only really talking to Illivan but has recently taken to talking to Adara as well.

Trust comes slowly to her but Illivan holds a great deal of trust with her, and she generally trusts people he does.

export.name: Research: Crystaline Effects on Illusions
export.description: You have been tasked with finding the effects of power crystals on illusions both in and out of combat.

export.name: Research: Rock Crabs of Sulendirida
export.description: You have been tasked with learning more about the Rock Crabs on Sulendirida who's backs grew refined power crystals and more about the cave in which they went to bury themselves.

export.name: Using a Power Crystal
export.description:
It seems that holding a power crystal in one's hand and focusing arcane magic can empower certain spells or cause certain reactions beyond just passing through a portal.

The extent to which this happens seems vast and the reactions seem to vary slightly. Perhaps there is more to learn here.

export.name: Hide the Blade Artifact
export.description:
You are keenly aware now that a secret sect of the Arcane Society that is looking for the artifact knows you have the ${"content":"Blade of the Mist", "class": "rs-orange"}$.

After talking with ${Lar,darkorange}$, he recommended hiding it and not letting anyone know.

Location of Wyrm guardian Entel.

He roams a 20 mile radius underground causing tremors.

export.name: Travels: The Isomere Bog Village
export.description:
After dispelling the final trap in ${"content":"Ilerar","class":"rs-orange"}$'s hideout, the group ventured back out into the cave and explored the other end which appeared to simply be a distraction to discourage people from venturing in too far.

Setting out toward the south, several torches were found lit after a few days of travel and the group found a carivan of traders who seem to travel across ${"content":"Colligus","class":"rs-orange"}$ distributing goods to the various small settlements on the continent that manage to survive, sometimes arriving to nothing but emptiness or ruins were once a group of people lived. Later discovering that they are called ${"content":"The Carivan of Souls","class":"rs-orange"}$.

Looking for safe travel across part of the continent and hoping to gain more information, the group talked their way into joining the carivan on it's way to the ${"content":"Isomere Bog","class":"rs-orange"}$ where a small settlement was dealing with the corrupted bog that Isomere had become.

While talking to them over a week or so of travel, the group learned that entry to ${"content":"Curell","class":"rs-orange"}$ was governed by ${"content":"Meisters","class":"rs-orange"}$ who had some way of finding out about deeds of things done across the continent and would mark people as allowed to come to the city. As the group had no such marking, the people of the carivan were careful not to discuss the city with them but were happy to talk about other things like the history of the ${"content":"Isomere Bog","class":"rs-orange"}$ and the ${"content":"Clipeum Druids of Western Colligus","class":"rs-orange"}$.

On reaching the small settlement of 7 buildings, a garden, and a warehouse, the group met ${"content":"Matriarch Evien","class":"rs-orange"}$, who served as a sort of leader or guide to the people of the settlement. They learned more of the Bog from her and that several people had gone missing into the bog from the spirits taking them or the ghouls or possessed beasts eating them. After some discuss, the Matriarch was convinced that the group was truly interested in removing whatever curse or desecration was cast over the Bog. She talked to the others in the settlement and despite their desire for privacy, they were willing to let the group stay for ${"content":"400","class":"rs-orange"}$ gold a night. An important point for safety as their buildings are protected by a device using ${"content":"Power Crystals","class":"rs-orange"}$ to essentially continuously cast ${"content":"Protection from Evil","class":"rs-orange"}$ on them to keep wandering ghosts out.

During the night, the group saw ${"content":"Eursloc","class":"rs-orange"}$, a teen boy thought lost and watched as several ghosts possessed his body. Lowering a Larry down, they tried to have the skeleton construct retireve the boy but were unsuccessful. The following morning they heard the mother crying and made an effort to comfort her that seemed to fall on appreciative ears.

In the morning, they ventured into the Bog and using ${"content":"Detect Magic","class":"rs-orange"}$ managed to follow the growing strength of the corruption and found a hut, where they were told to leave. After a quick refusal the hut to the door appeared to burst open...

export.name: The Isomere Bog
export.description: A corrupted bog, a small settlement lies nearby with a very private group of individuals.

export.name: The Esclau Commune
export.description: A small settlement on the edge of the Isomere Bog, a group of very private people live here.

export.name: Corruption of the Isomere Bog
export.description: Believed to be corrupted by someone or something, removing the corruption could prove important to the Meister's who grant access to Curell.

export.name: Entry to the City of Curell
export.description: A group of people referred to as ${"content":"Meister","class":"rs-orange"}$s seem to control access to the city and gaining favor with them by helping the people of the continent or other ways seems like it might be necessary for entering the city, or being allowed to be told where it even is.

export.name: Information on the City of Curell
export.description:
The city of Curell is not the Pirate city it was thought to be but more a closely guarded secret for those who live on ${"content":"Colligus","class":"rs-orange"}$ as a place to get away from the nations and governments and keep a private life on the remote continent.

Entry is deemed by the ${"content":"Meister","class":"rs-orange"}$s and it is likely fairly well protected to fend off the beasts on the continent.

export.name: The Caravan of Souls
export.description:
Known for their devotion to ${"content":"Colligus","class":"rs-orange"}$ and the life of serenity it can offer, they travel across the continent delivering good to remote settlements, using trade in Curell to help provide.

Their name comes from the help they give to save those on the fringes of survival in the hard forests of ${"content":"Colligus","class":"rs-orange"}$ and for the bodies of the dead they bring back to the city for burial from settlements lost to the night.

export.name: Piyaqua Iscosan
export.description: A wizard of sorts who lived with the ${"content":"Esclau Commune","class":"rs-orange"}$ researching the near-by ${"content":"Isomere Bog","class":"rs-orange"}$ before it was corrupted and continued after it was corrupted, eventually never returning from the bog.

export.name: Save Eursloc?
export.description: A mother in the ${"content":"Esclau Commune","class":"rs-orange"}$ lost her son ${"content":"Eursloc","class":"rs-orange"}$ to the ghosts of the bog and he has recently been seen on the edges of the bog and seems to still be alive.

export.name: Gisengard Scales for Rieal
export.description:
${"content":"Rieal","class":"rs-orange"}$ in ${"content":"Dranous","class":"rs-orange"}$ needs some ${"content":"Gisengard Scales","class":"rs-orange"}$ for a project he's working on and is willing to pay ${"content":"1000","class":"rs-orange"}$ for a ${"content":"Arcane","class":"rs-orange"}$ scale, and he hinted that extra maybe usable to make something nice for someone. However, with the description of the scales, they may also be useful to take to ${"content":"Via","class":"rs-orange"}$

He admits that the arcane scales are rare and quite difficult to get, not only for the rarity but the toughness of the beasts. But he is aware of a small group southwest of the city, maybe one could be isolated?

However with the increasing security and cities being destroyed, venturing across the countryside poses its own risks in itself these days.

export.name: Travels: The Reverse Heist
export.description:
Wrapping up in ${"content":"SaBrac","class":"rs-orange"}$, the fake note was recovered after knocking a poor ${"content":"Jim","class":"rs-orange"}$ and rustling through his clothes and then everyone returning to the boat where ${"content":"Po","class":"rs-orange"}$ mentioned that ${"content":"Lar","class":"rs-orange"}$ had requested help in ${"content":"Dranous","class":"rs-orange"}$.

A small diving adventure proceeded where the ${"content":"Large Demon","class":"rs-orange"}$ jumped off the cliff and a cave was found under the water next to the factory. A sturdy door barred entry further and after some discussion a decision was made to keep a note about the door but to hide the artifact before risking a possibly large encounter.

On their trip to Sulendirida, ${"content":"Po","class":"rs-orange"}$ and the others on the ship spoke of themselves, giving the group their real names and histories. And a ${"content":"Scroll of Arcane Portcullis","class":"rs-orange"}$ so that they could be called if needed. The rest of the trip was filled with song and stories.

Venturing out, the ${"content":"Kintari Throne","class":"rs-orange"}$ room was easily found on ${"content":"Sulendirida","class":"rs-orange"}$ and the ${"content":"Artifact","class":"rs-orange"}$ hidden in the throne room. Taking the crystals and venturing out. Carefully sneaking, the Kintari looking for the intruders on their island barely missed the group, giving pursuit late and chasing everyone off a near by cliff and leaving them to swim back to their boat. The only curiosity being the ${"content":"Great Wyrm","class":"rs-orange"}$ that seemd to be working with the ${"content":"Kintari","class":"rs-orange"}$. But the ${"content":"Crown","class":"rs-orange"}$ was now in the hands of the group and the ${"content":"Artifact","class":"rs-orange"}$ seemingly safe.

Returning to ${"content":"Dranous","class":"rs-orange"}$, shopping ensued, the group meeting ${"content":"Rieal","class":"rs-orange"}$, a flamboyant shopkeeper who seems to keep odd hours and sell interesting goods. On trying to get some additional money to by goods, he mentioned a need for ${"content":"Arcane Gisengard Scales","class":"rs-orange"}$ but was quite happy with ${"content":"Xylaris","class":"rs-orange"}$ as she happily dispensed delicious tea.

After shopping, the group met with ${"content":"Lar","class":"rs-orange"}$, freshly out of a city meeting, he mentioned that the need for help was a skilled assassin in the city going after ${"content":"Imperial Librarians","class":"rs-orange"}$ and that they knew she was in the town through a connection in the ${"content":"Thieves Guild","class":"rs-orange"}$.

export.name: Travels: Assassin in the Capital
export.description:
After briefing ${Lar}$ on their journey to ${"content": "Sa Brac","class": "rs-darkorange"}$, Lar informed the group of a troublign assassin somewhere in the city limits. On learning this, the group set off to find the librarians and get a sense of the happenings around the city.

On arriving at the library, banners hung for a coming party for the coming ${"content": "Research Gala","class": "rs-darkorange"}$, and the group met with the head librarian ${Amavie}$, and her assistant ${Cellea}$. The pair quite noticable for their distinct look; ${Amavie}$'s cat ears and tail, and ${Cellea}$'s witch hat. From the 2, the group learned of the coming Gala and that measures were being taken in case the assassin showed while ${Norwind}$ explored the near-by roof tops.

Exploring the library showed no particular signs of activity, but did prove that it would be easy to hide and sneak through the shelves. Meanwhile, a shadowy figure caught the eye of ${Norwind}$, who then found that the ${"content": "Demon from Sa Brac","class": "rs-darkorange"}$ was also in Dranous, though his pressence did not seem to draw much attention. Sneaking back into the shadows, ${Norwind}$ ventured back to meet up with his compatriots to bring them up to speed on his findings.

On his way back, he stumbled across ${Amavie}$ and ${Cellea}$, recognizing them as librarians and intrigued by the feline features, he followed them down to ${"content": "Ixa's Pub","class": "rs-darkorange"}$, where he ran into the rest of the group as well.

Drinking and talking ensued where the group learned of a half-elf in the city with a large black crossbow that seemed to be cursed with a heavy shadow and ${Xylaris}$'s eye was caught by a shadowy figure seeming to stalk around the bar, but if someone was there, they eluded her. Returning, the group seemed in good spirits as ${Torrin}$ and ${Norwind}$ flirted with ${Amavie}$ and ${Cellea}$, earning an invite to the Gala at the request of ${Amavie}$ herself, and ${Torrin}$ a particularly rough, but great night with ${Cellea}$ despite ${Orla}$'s attempts to the contrary.

During the rest of the flirting and chatting, the group also met the other librarians;
+ ${Urunte}$ A particularly stoic white dragonborn, who works with the jovian half-elf ${Bisum}$ to maintain the ${"content": "Historical","class": "rs-darkorange"}$ section on the top floor of the library
+ ${Celec}$ New to the library and now overseeing the ${"content": "Arcane Spells","class": "rs-darkorange"}$ section.
+ ${Horus}$ A casual human male who oversees the ${"content": "Alchemy","class": "rs-darkorange"}$ section and ${Norwind}$ keenly noted as having a connection to the Theives' Guild.
+ ${Storvia}$ An eccentric female Gnome overseeing the ${"content": "Enchanting","class": "rs-darkorange"}$ section.
+ ${Tekusa}$ A somewhat weak, but sharp female elf who knows a great deal about the geology of the world and is responsible for the ${"content": "Geological Information","class": "rs-darkorange"}$ within the library.
+ and ${Ithim}$, insolent and not quite liked by everyone but is well managed by ${Amavie}$ and does a maticulous job of maintaining the ${"content": "Retired Books","class": "rs-darkorange"}$ in the basement of the library.

A number of other assistants come and go, but notably ${Niena}$, a blue female Dragonborn and a black male Dragonborn ${Drovac}$ manage the reception desk.

As the Gala started, many poeple arrived, including a delegation of ${"content": "Nautilin Librarians","class": "rs-darkorange"}$, ${Lar}$, the royal research adviser ${Ceran}$, and the royal resource adviser ${Inale}$. Once inside, the group set out to follow their current suspects of ${Horus}$ and ${Drovac}$ while keeping an open eye on others in the area. And while ${Horus}$ seemed to be enjoying himself, the group lost track of ${Drovac}$ for sometime and ${Xylaris}$ ran into him on the third floor and fumbled a few attempts at convincing him that she was following after him with a crush that he didn't seem to buy. After which she followed him to the basement and the minimalist decorations giving little to no cover had him run into her again before joining the Gala himself.

Shortly after while patrolling the floors, ${Torrin}$ found 2 dead guards on the third floor and set out to notify the guards, who then followed ${Lar}$'s pre-described protocol to lock down the building. Securing everyone in the 2-story ballroom, Draconian Guards secured the first floor and the librarians while ${Orla}$ and ${Torrin}$ set out to sweep the building from the basement up. ${Norwind}$, ${Natty}$, and ${Xylaris}$ staying in the ballroom to help guard against the suspected attack.

While sweeping the second floor, a huge crossbow bolt ripped through the walls of the library. shreading several guards and greatly wounding ${Urunte}$ and ${Bisum}$, as well as almost knocking ${Orla}$ unconscious. Pressing on, ${Torrin}$ and ${Orla}$ found a shadowy figure in a ${"content": "Blue Cubical Shield","class": "rs-darkorange"}$ with a dark crossbow mounted in the middle. Attempting to throw the figure of their balance, they both threw spells at her, casting through the blue barrier and each feeling a surge of energy as they did. ${Torrin}$'s fog cloud filling the entire second flood of the library and ${Orla}$'s major image seeming to almost overwhelm their culprit until the spell was somehow cancelled by the figure. ${Horvin}$, ${Amavie}$'s friend and one of the guards ${Orla}$ had befriended in the rafters, joined after hearing a crossbolt rip through the walls and quickly joined ${Orla}$ and ${Torrin}$ in attacking the figure, running head long into the cube, sneakily with ${Xylaris}$' help to get him through the barrier as she herself snuck off into a corner.

A quick engagement with the assassin ensued as ${Horvin}$ was flug unconscious into near-by bookshelves as the assassin unleashed another volley of attacks at everyone, and after a quick exchange with ${Orla}$ and ${Torrin}$, blew out one of the barriered windows and ran to escape, ${Xylaris}$ using her shadowy position to stab the figure in the side as she fled, catching her off-guard, but the figure held its composure as ${Torrin}$ tried to catch her with ${"content": "Call Lightning","class": "rs-darkorange"}$, which she somehow managed to escape with a seemingly short range teleportation.

Landing on the ground below, she began to take off down the road as the three near by began to consider pursuit...

export.name: Travels: Witch of the Isomere Bog
export.description:
Battling the witch and her minions took all of the teams strength. After fighting her outside of her hut and gaining an advantage, the witch retreated into her hutt and down a long corridor to an unusual device. The faster of the group giving chase as the slower ones searched the hutt for clues or useful items, finding spells and some alchemical potion brewing in a cauldron.

Fighting around the device, the witch started something within a ${"content":"Corruption Stone","class":"rs-orange"}$ that caused it to give off dark purple arcane bolts of energy. The group managed cancel out whatever enchantment had been placed on the stone and returned to the Witch's hut to rest.

As they laid down, the fog seemed to have cleared and the morning sun gently lit the bog's floor. Somewhere out here there may be a distraught and exhausted ${"content":"Eursloc Regunoc","class":"rs-orange"}$, but the village will certainly be happy that the bog is no longer cursed.

export.name: Meisters of Curell
export.description: The ${"content":"Meisters","class":"rs-orange"}$ of ${"content":"Curell","class":"rs-orange"}$ are akin to its rulers and oversee the city and its laws. They are most known for their control over who is allowed in and out of the city.

export.name: Travels: Lost Souls of Esclau
export.description:
After defeating the witch of the bog, a party was thrown to celebrate with ${"content":"Lucy","class":"rs-orange"}$ and ${"content":"Ginnet","class":"rs-orange"}$ putting on a show for the town while partaking of the local spirits.

After the party, ${"content":"Ginnet","class":"rs-orange"}$ asked around about the locket and learned of ${"content":"Tureana","class":"rs-orange"}$, ${"content":"Piyaqua","class":"rs-orange"}$, and their childhood as well as more history about the commune and their meditation. A detail about a sacred spot in the bog standing out in the midst of the details from the old man.

Returning to the hutt where they fought the witch, they explored the site. The cauldron still brewing with some alchemical mixture was dispelled and extinquished, the brew turning to a sludge of which ${"content":"Quincy","class":"rs-orange"}$ collected a sample. Exploring down the hallway, they found the witch's head and body untouched by signs of decay and an uneasy sense of skeletal remains in the hallway where the witch so easily summoned skeletons before.

Taking the head with them for safe keeping and possibly a conversation the next day, the group set off back to the ${"content":"Esclau Commune","class":"rs-orange"}$. However, as ${"content":"Eldith","class":"rs-orange"}$ was uneasy with the witch's lingering eyes, the head was left in a box outside under a tree as the group slept through the rest of the night. Bringing a few skeletons with them for ${"content":"Ash","class":"rs-orange"}$.

An early morning followed, ${"content":"Ginnet","class":"rs-orange"}$ pranking  ${"content":"Eldith","class":"rs-orange"}$ with visions of the witch's head on her pillow helped lighten the mood going into the attempt at casting ${"content":"Speak with the Dead","class":"rs-orange"}$ on the witch's head. When that had no effect, many theories arose; Her life locked in the ${"content":"Locket","class":"rs-orange"}$, another painting of her somewhere in the village, dispelling her body, burning her head.

After tearing up the ${"content":"Tureana","class":"rs-orange"}$'s picture in the locket, who they had identified as the sister who was the witch, the group burned her head in an attempt to ensure the witch was dead and returning to the hutt to burn the body, only to find the body had burned up as well. But coming to the sense that there were many lost souls at the end of that hallway where the ${"content":"Corruption Stone","class":"rs-orange"}$ was found.

Back in the town and asking around more, they learned of the patriarch prior to ${"content":"Evien","class":"rs-orange"}$, a man by the name of ${"content":"Iquist","class":"rs-orange"}$ who they discovered foudned the commune more than a hundred years ago and that he had been using members of the communce as sacrifices to extend his own life. The witch, had come about when ${"content":"Tureana","class":"rs-orange"}$ fought back, causing his spell to go astray and transfering his soul into her body, locking them in a struggle for control and leading to paranoia.

Searching around, they convinced ${"content":"Evien","class":"rs-orange"}$ to help in a few ways, succeeding in using an ${"content":"Elixir of Ospensar","class":"rs-orange"}$ to loosen her tongue about ${"content":"Iquist","class":"rs-orange"}$'s past and building a bond which helped later in getting ascess to ${"content":"Iquist","class":"rs-orange"}$'s journal with the spell for soul transferance.

With the ${"content":"Carivan of Souls","class":"rs-orange"}$ back in town, the group's final act was to ask ${"content":"Airyvana","class":"rs-orange"}$ for a few hours while they went back to visit the souls with an ${"content":"Elixir of Morletum","class":"rs-orange"}$ to speak with them.

For the ten minutes of the spell, ${"content":"Ginnet","class":"rs-orange"}$ asked just a few of the hundreds of souls lost down in the hallway questions trying to piece together what happened. Even seeing ${"content":"Iquist","class":"rs-orange"}$ himself before his soul rejected ${"content":"Ginnet","class":"rs-orange"}$'s pressence. There they confirmed their theories and ${"content":"Ginnet","class":"rs-orange"}$ heard a woman call out right as the potion faded.

Checking with the journal and praying to ${"content":"Dionysus","class":"rs-orange"}$, ${"content":"Quincy","class":"rs-orange"}$ created a blessed shrine to his god in the hallway, bringing rest to the souls that were there. As the spirits settled, he learned of the blessing on the locket. Perhaps ${"content":"Dionysus","class":"rs-orange"}$ can help repair it as well...?

export.name: Panther Druid of Claruthano
export.description:
Known as Stibusix by most, his reputation as a powerful druid used to proceed him, however he hasn't been seen in quite some time.

Known for wandering around the world as a common house cat, he is known to commonly be found protecting children and is very slow to trust anyone.

According to ${Iquist, orange}$'s journal, they used to be friends but apparently had a strong falling out with him once Stibusix learned what was happening in the ${"content": "Esclau Commune", "class": "rs-orange"}$.

Iquist goes on to describe an intricate staff used by Stibusix that bore a cat figure at one end. Noting that the staff seemed unusually powerful and regretting never getting a hold of it.

export.name: The Blessings of Dionysus
export.description:
A strong act of divine direction strengthened your bond with Dionysus.

In a flash of spiritual understanding, you learned to bring a great blessing to the brews of the world.

export.name: Dimension Door
export.description: You've learned the spell Dimension Door

export.name: Travels: Arrival at Curell
export.description:
Having finished with the witch, ${"content":"Iquist", "class":"rs-orange"}$, and putting the souls to rest, the group set off for the city of ${"content":"Curell", "class":"rs-orange"}$ with the ${"content":"Carivan of Souls", "class":"rs-orange"}$, riding in the Apple cart for the approximately week long journey to obscure the city's location if needed.

On arriving, everyone was sequestered in the ${"content":"Zephora Inn", "class":"rs-orange"}$ for the night to be interviewed by ${"content":"Matriarch Evien", "class":"rs-orange"}$'s friend ${"content":"Meister Evan", "class":"rs-orange"}$ the next day. A peaceful rest passed with the group chatting and stretching, now free of the apple cart.

In the morning, ${"content":"Meister Evan", "class":"rs-orange"}$ arrived, knocking politely to enter the room, which ${"content":"Ash", "class":"rs-orange"}$ responded with by using the ${"content":"Knock Scroll", "class":"rs-orange"}$ to ${"content":"Evan", "class":"rs-orange"}$'s entertainment. On talking to ${"content":"Meister Evan", "class":"rs-orange"}$, the group explained that they were from ${"content":"Ascaqua", "class":"rs-orange"}$ and on the search for a ${"content":"Red Pirate", "class":"rs-orange"}$, not disclosing a name they had learned for her.

${"content":"Meister Evan", "class":"rs-orange"}$ accepted the story and noted that ${"content":"Evien", "class":"rs-orange"}$ seemed to trust the group fully and that he would as well. He went on to explain that he had seen someone similar dropped off in the city by ${"content":"Ilerar", "class":"rs-orange"}$. On leaving, ${"content":"Meister Evan", "class":"rs-orange"}$ noted that the group could come to speak to the ${"content":"Meisters", "class":"rs-orange"}$ at their liesure, as they try to keep an open door to the people in the city.

After ${"content":"Meister Evan", "class":"rs-orange"}$ left, the group set out on the town, find shops and temples to ${"content":"Dionysus", "class":"rs-orange"}$, ${"content":"Zeus", "class":"rs-orange"}$, ${"content":"Athena", "class":"rs-orange"}$, and ${"content":"Serinal", "class":"rs-orange"}$. Drinks were while the group contemplated how to find ${"content":"Ilerar", "class":"rs-orange"}$ or ${"content":"Irena Sollace", "class":"rs-orange"}$ and old friends were found as they ran into ${"content":"Llera", "class":"rs-orange"}$ and ${"content":"Beren", "class":"rs-orange"}$ Linja as well as their friend ${"content":"Aresa Voltini", "class":"rs-orange"}$.

While some of the group caught up ${"content":"Ash", "class":"rs-orange"}$ sought out knowledge regarding the ${"content":"Runes", "class":"rs-orange"}$ at the ${"content":"Temple of Zeus", "class":"rs-orange"}$ but an alcolyte informed him that he would have better luck at a library or a ${"content":"Temple of Daminoth", "class":"rs-orange"}$.

On rejoining with each other and the ${"content":"Linjas", "class":"rs-orange"}$ off to bed, the group set off around town and stumbled on a building seeming to belong to the ${"content":"Arcane Society", "class":"rs-orange"}$ but on inquirying to the building, the group was simply dismissed and told to leave. The next morning, talking to the ${"content":"Linjas", "class":"rs-orange"}$ before they left, they were told that it maybe a private researcher and were told of some strange ${"content":"Alcolytes", "class":"rs-orange"}$ that ${"content":"Beren", "class":"rs-orange"}$ had seen before but never had a good explaination of them.

Settling on talking to the ${"content":"Meisters", "class":"rs-orange"}$ to seek an introduction with ${"content":"Ilerar", "class":"rs-orange"}$, the group made a plea that they needed to ship goods off record and had heard that ${"content":"Ilerar", "class":"rs-orange"}$ is the person with whom to speak on these regards.

After considering the request, the few ${"content":"Meisters", "class":"rs-orange"}$ present were convinced by ${"content":"Meister Avora", "class":"rs-orange"}$ to let the group deal with the city's problem to the south as payment for a possible introduction. The issue being a large disappearance of multiple members of the city. While not unusual for people for be killed or taken by animals on the continent, the number of people who were taken and the lack of evidence was concerning. Four guards had gone missing and normally 2 are able to at least drive back any aggressive wild life. And while kidnapping was suspected, the disarray in the area seemed to discount that. The city's rangers while checking over night had been unable to quite determine the cause, suspecting a ${"content":"Werewolf", "class":"rs-orange"}$, ${"content":"Pirates", "class":"rs-orange"}$, ${"content":"Spiders", "class":"rs-orange"}$, or a ${"content":"Veldyr", "class":"rs-orange"}$. But the crime scene did not quite add up to either.

Between the group leaving, ${"content":"Lucy", "class":"rs-orange"}$ inquired with ${"content":"Meister Avora", "class":"rs-orange"}$ on the origin of her suit, and she explained that her Chambermaid had sewn it for her, and they both agreed that it was hard to find a good semstress in ${"content":"Curell", "class":"rs-orange"}$. On asking if ${"content":"Avora's Chambermaid", "class":"rs-orange"}$ could sew something for ${"content":"Lucy", "class":"rs-orange"}$, ${"content":"Avora", "class":"rs-orange"}$ responded that it would be ${"content":"1000", "class":"rs-orange"}$G for a consultation and measurement. When ${"content":"Lucy", "class":"rs-orange"}$ noted that was a bit high, ${"content":"Avora", "class":"rs-orange"}$ said that she may be able to go lower depending on the results of their task and to check back afterwards.

Before heading south, the group went to the bar and sought to find one of the Rangers they had seen before. On arriving so early in the morning, one range sat alone drinking, and after some discussion, they manged to convince ${"content":"Creara Vinan", "class":"rs-orange"}$ to join them, for the low price of ${"content":"200", "class":"rs-orange"}$G.

Heading south with their new companion and expert tracker, they gently helped her as she assessed the situation, catching even the faintest of traces of evidence and determining that a ${"content":"Giant Spider", "class":"rs-orange"}$ was responsible, but only after finding very faint traces of webbing, a fact that is generally rare in the case of a ${"content":"Giant Spider", "class":"rs-orange"}$ attack. As ${"content":"Creara", "class":"rs-orange"}$ set off to leave, the group again persuaded her to stay and guide them, and possibly even assist. To which she agreed, for another ${"content":"200", "class":"rs-orange"}$G.

Following the faint trail that ${"content":"Creara", "class":"rs-orange"}$ had found, led the group to a giant cave in the side of a mountain near ${"content":"Curell", "class":"rs-orange"}$. Venturing in with the advantage of the time of day, the light quickly faded as they went deep into the tunnel. A few smaller spiders roaming the cave were briefly visible in the light and seen burrowing into the rock to find, revealing that the spiders with ${"content":"Rock Spiders", "class":"rs-orange"}$. ${"content":"Creara", "class":"rs-orange"}$ warned that the rock spiders have some basic intelligence and tactics and may try to flank the group from behind or otherwise cut off their retreat. And with the guard raised, they ventured further in, reaching a large cave opening with a small stream running through it...

export.name: Avora's Chambermaid and Seamstress
export.description:
${"content":"Meister Avora", "class":"rs-orange"}$ mentioned that she would let her chambermaid measure you and look into creating a suit for you for ${"content":"1000", "class":"rs-orange"}$G, which seemed a bit much.

She seems to think that she may go lower depending on how well the situation on the southern outskirts of ${"content":"Curell", "class":"rs-orange"}$ is handled...

export.name: Issues to the South
export.description: ${"content":"Meister Avora", "class":"rs-orange"}$ has convinced the council of ${"content":"Curell", "class":"rs-orange"}$ to give you an introduction to ${"content":"Ilerar", "class":"rs-orange"}$ in exchange for solving the issue that occurred along the southern border of the town last night.

export.name: Travels: The Chase
export.description:
Having caught the assassin in the act and managing to keep the librarians ${"content": "Bisum","class": "rs-darkorange"}$ and ${"content": "Urunte","class": "rs-darkorange"}$ alive, the group set off in pursuit as the assassin jumped from the window.

A heavy fog was set on the city to hide her escape, only slightly delaying the group's pursuit as they split up to check from rooftops and the ground. Screaming from the citizens made tracking difficult and an old man was caught in the midst of dagger throwing, but was later stabilized.

After the exchange, a dagger found ${"content": "Norwind","class": "rs-darkorange"}$ and when the assassin came to retrieve her blade, she found him alive and putting up a fight.

The scruffle delayed her enoough for the others to catch up and she retreated into the obscurity of the fog again with the group giving chase, finding her in an odd home in the city.

Delving inside, the group was met with misdirection and traps. With their health low and spells at a premium, they set off back to the library to talk to ${"content": "Lar","class": "rs-darkorange"}$ again.

With the evidence at hand, ${"content": "Lar","class": "rs-darkorange"}$ recommended the group talk to ${"content": "Po","class": "rs-darkorange"}$, indicating Po might have some insight into what happened.

Back aboard the boat, the group was regaled with a small story from ${"content": "Po","class": "rs-darkorange"}$'s past about a powerful cursed crossbow, ${"content": "Harbinger","class": "rs-darkorange"}$. A heavy black crossbow with a ghostly dark purple shadow. He recalled hunting an assassin long ago who had forced ${"content": "Via","class": "rs-darkorange"}$ to make it, and remembered that he had commissioned her to create a counterpart that could withstand it, ${"content": "Lucera","class": "rs-darkorange"}$. 

${"content": "Via","class": "rs-darkorange"}$ had wanted to forget about her creation, distraught with the havoc it brought. But ${"content": "Po","class": "rs-darkorange"}$ convinced her that a new crossbow could be buiilt to level the battlefield and offered ${"content": "20,000","class": "rs-darkorange"}$G to do it, paying half upfront and half when he came back to retrieve it, thouogh he never returned to retrieve the item.

Deciding that retrieving ${"content": "Lucera","class": "rs-darkorange"}$ was vital to their mission, the group recalled a request from ${"content": "Lemuli","class": "rs-darkorange"}$ to retrieve his enchanting stones from a young dragon on the continent of ${"content": "Claruthano","class": "rs-darkorange"}$, East of ${"content": "Draconia","class": "rs-darkorange"}$. The goal being to steal the dragons gold to fund the purchase of ${"content": "Lucera","class": "rs-darkorange"}$. And with ${"content": "Po","class": "rs-darkorange"}$ putting up ${"content": "5000","class": "rs-darkorange"}$G to help, the bonus of the enchanted book from ${"content": "Lemuli","class": "rs-darkorange"}$ would be a nice bonus.

Agreeing to the idea, they all set off for ${"content": "Claruthano","class": "rs-darkorange"}$ to see about a dragon...

export.name: Lemuli's Enchanting Stones
export.description:
Somewhere around the marked area in ${"content": "Claruthano","class": "rs-darkorange"}$ is where ${"content": "Lemuli","class": "rs-darkorange"}$ last setup camp with his ${"content": "Enchanting Stones","class": "rs-darkorange"}$.

While there, a young dragon setup a clever distraction, causing ${"content": "Lemuli","class": "rs-darkorange"}$ to leave his stones in his tent while he ventured out. After leaving, the dragon stole his stones and retreated to a near-by cave, where ${"content": "Lemuli","class": "rs-darkorange"}$ believes the dragon's lair is.

${"content": "Lemuli","class": "rs-darkorange"}$ has long since given up on ever getting these stones back, but should you manage to retrieve them, he is willing to sell his last enchanted book.

export.name: Ritual: Connecting Sending Stones
export.description:
You've learned the ritual for connecting and disconnecting ${"content":"Sending Stones","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

Whether connecting or disconnecting, you will need 2 or more stones, 2 ${"content":"Power Crystals","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ where their color is important, and 16 ${"content":"Enchanting Herbs","class":"rs-darkorange"}$. All ingredients are usually consumed.

If you're disconnecting stones, you need crystals that are the opposite of the color of the stones.

If you're connecting stones, the stones must not be connected and the 2 crystals determine the color the stones assume. If that color already has stones connected, you must pass an   ${"content":"Arcana", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ Check (DC${"content":"35", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$) to save the power crystals.

If you're connecting stones, 1 of the stones in the ritual may be the color  to which you're trying to connect, and will require an ${"content":"Arcana", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ Check (DC${"content":"20", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$).

export.name: Alchemy: Exuberous Brew
export.description:
You know how to brew ${"content":"Exuberous Tea","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

It can be brewed with common ingredients and is simply delicious, but when brewed with an ${"content":"Alchemy Ingredient Bundle","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, it gives the drinker confidence and grants them an additional ${1d4,orange}$ on their next skill check (Does not apply to saves, lasts 2 minutes).

Requires a ${"content":"Tea Pot","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and if not using an ingredient bundle, reasonable on hand herbs.

export.name: Alchemy: Anti-Venom
export.description:
You know how to brew ${"content":"Anti-Venom","class":"rs-darkorange"}$. Can be used to cure the same venom as from the venom sac used.

At a Alchemy Kit DC5 - Uses:
+ 1 ${"content":"Flask","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 1 ${"content":"Venom Sac","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 1 ${"content":"Alchemy Ingredient Bundle","class":"rs-darkorange"}$

Adding an additional 
${"content":"Alchemy Ingredient Bundle","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ removes the requirement to pass a skill-check.

export.name: Alchemy: Smokebomb
export.description:
You know how to create a ${"content":"Smokebomb","class":"rs-darkorange"}$. When thrown on the ground, heavily obscures an area. Strong light or daylight can give shadows.

Takes the below with an Alchemy Kit skill check:
+ 1 ${"content":"Flask","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 1 ${"content":"Autus Leaf","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 1 ${"content":"Alchemy Ingredient Bundle","class":"rs-darkorange"}$

DC10 to create at least 1 bomb.
+ 15: Yields 2
+ 20: Yields 3
+ 25: Yields 3
+ 30: Yields 4
+ 35: Yields 5

export.name: Alchemy: Flashbomb
export.description:
You know how to create a ${"content":"Flashbomb","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ that has a chance to blind all creatures in an area.

Takes the below with an Alchemy Kit skill check:
+ 1 ${"content":"Flask","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 1 ${"content":"Lumen Leaf","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 1 ${"content":"Alchemy Ingredient Bundle","class":"rs-darkorange"}$

DC10 to create 1 bomb.

export.name: Alchemy: General Poison Remedy
export.description:
You know how to brew ${"content":"General Poison Remedy","class":"rs-darkorange"}$. When consumed, it can cure any poison.

An Alchemy Kit Skill Check at DC25:
+ 1 ${"content":"Flask","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 3 ${"content":"Venom Sac","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 3 ${"content":"Alchemy Ingredient Bundle","class":"rs-darkorange"}$

Alternatively, the Alchemy Kit skill check can be reduced to DC10 if the potions are brewed in a ${"content":"Cauldron","class":"rs-darkorange"}$. This style of brewing takes ${2/wis,orange}$ days per potion brewing. A flask is needed to collect the potion.

export.name: Travels: Landing in Claruthano
export.description:
Finishing some last minute shopping before heading to Claruthano, the group prepared for the long trip ahead, gathering normal supplies and a Fairy-esq cap that seems to have left ${"content":"Anna","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ ever so slightly enamoured with ${"content":"Natty","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ as they sailed across the seas.

The trip was rather uneventful but the arrival proved intriguing, as they found 3 distinct groups of recent foot prints pointing to more people being on the island.

As they set off into the jungles, they found a small wolf's den and ${"content":"Orla","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ managed to befriend a lone wolf who had came up from the den to investigate what was happening. While talking to their new friend, the group learned that the pack was away, and that the Dragon of their interest seems to hunt during the morning light. They thanked the wolf, leaving food for him and his pack, and set off on their way.

Setting up camp, the first night seemed uneventful, but the morning was intriguing, with the Dragon hunting and the group managing to catch a hint of 4 other Dragons on the continent as the light shone through the clouds. The Dragon of their interest near-by. Their scent seemed to almost get caught as they lingered near-by, trying to track the beast, and watched it fly back towards some mountains before losing it in the distance, gathering that it seemed to reside slightly north of where ${"content":"Lemuli","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ indicated his camp was.

During their travels, a thick magical storm seemed to cover the jungle land where they were. After a few hours of investigating and pondering as they traveled, they concluded it must have something to do with the Dragons on the continent. What that relationship was however eluded them.

Traveling farther, the group sought the camp first, hoping to find left overs or clues. In the midst of their sleep during their third night, the group was beset by an unknown group of people with an unknown intent, managing to defend themselves, ${"content":"Torrin","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ had a small barbecue with one of them, the rest seeming to disappear afterwards with the cover of night, and with their camp in disarray, the group decided to disembark as well as they were nearing the camp.

Descending a steep cliff, they used a grappling hook and left it for a hopeful quick return and crossed a vast barren field that they soon discovered was covered with holes connecting to a large spider burrow below, with uniquely large 3 foot tall spiders with long legs and thick bodies. Not quite giant and not quite cuddly. Sneaking across the field at night proved somewhat useful as the spiders seemed only passingly interested in the distrubances they were making, but as the spiders slowly caught up to the group, they found a need to quickly run for the end of the field, embarking in a mix of running and jumping to quick escape as the spider nest descended upon them after several attempts at distracting the hungry beasts.

While they managed to make it through the spiders, it came at a heavy cost as almost everyone was poisoned and not in terribly good shape. Looking around, they pooled their antidotes and ${"content":"Torrin","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and ${"content":"Natty","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ headed back to the field of spiders to get ${"content":"Venom Sac","class":"rs-darkorange"}$s for ${"content":"Xylaris","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ to quickly make several ${"content":"Anti-Venom","class":"rs-darkorange"}$s for the group.

Once everyone was healed, they finished their trek to the camp. On arriving, they found the barren remains of a camp that appeared to have been picked over and all but washed away. As they stopped to rest, ${"content":"Xylaris","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and ${"content":"Torrin","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ kept watch and managed to catch sight of 2 travelers heading toward their new resting place.

Setting up for an ambush, the pair found themselves caught off gaurd but managed to easily put down the would be attackers, ${"content":"Xylaris","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ eviserating one with fire and ice and throwing the mangled body down off the cliff next to his friend as ${"content":"Torrin","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ commanded the other to answer several questions.

Through the interrogation, they learned that the people attacking them were seemingly not part of the first group to attack them and that these 2 were actually servants of ${"content":"Cthulhu","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and that there was a temple to the south. Not appearing to have much else in useful information, they dispatched the other and informed the rest of the group. ${"content":"Torrin","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ taking particular interest as ${"content":"Cthulhu","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ is likely the one responsible for the destruction of his village.

However, while talking, they caught notice of the first killed servant seeming to return to life, though the turning of his flesh seemed to indicate more of a zombie like return than a resurrection. Not wanting to find out, the group quickly dispatched and burned [${"content":"Ret-Con","class":"rs-darkred"}$] the bodies to ensure they stayed dead.

Now, they prepare themselves, determining whether to set off south to visit the ${"content":"Temple of Cthulhu","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ or north to visit the ${"content":"Adult Black Dragon","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ that they believe has ${"content":"Lemuli","class":"rs-darkorange"}$'s enchanting stones.

export.name: Doorway Entry Markings in Curell
export.description:
${"content":"The Tint of the Shadows","class":"rs-darkorange"}$

The shadows are what guide us.

We must avoid the light.

export.name: Curse Ritual: Hexed Sight
export.description:
A creature suffering from ${"content":"Hexed Sight","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ is unable to see that which was named when it was cursed.

The ritual for cursing or removing the curse requires the same ingredients:

+ Creature to Curse or Purify
+ 1 ${"content":"Enchanters Kit","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 1 ${"content":"Corruption Stone","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 1 ${"content":"Vial of Elemental Psychosis","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ (Consumed)
+ 10 ${"content":"Enchanting Herbs","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ (Consumed)
+ 1 Named Item or Creature
+ 1 Hour

Must pass a DC${20,orange}$  - ${30,orange}$ Enchanter's Kit check to remove the curse depending on the named item or creature.

Cursing an item will shift your alignment toward evil unless you pass a DC${40,orange}$ Wisdom save.

Removing a curse does nothing to your alignment.

export.name: Curse Ritual: Force Restraint
export.description:
Cursed items bind to the attuned and inflict damage when the creature gains consciousness.

The ritual for cursing or removing the curse requires the same ingredients:

+ The Item to Curse or Purify
+ 1 ${"content":"Enchanters Kit","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 1 ${"content":"Corruption Stone","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 1 ${"content":"Takn Leaf","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ (Consumed)
+ 10 ${"content":"Enchanting Herbs","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ (Consumed)
+ 1 Hour

Must pass a DC${20,orange}$ Enchanter's Kit check to remove the curse.

Cursing an item will shift your alignment toward evil unless you pass a DC${40,orange}$ Wisdom save.

Removing a curse does nothing to your alignment.

export.name: Enchanting: Create a Corruption Stone
export.description:
Ritual for creating a ${"content":"Corruption Stone","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.
+ 1 ${"content":"Elemental Enchanting Stone","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ (Corrupted)
+ 6 ${"content":"Living Creatures","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ of size small or greater (Consumed)
+ 16 ${"content":"Enchanting Herbs","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ (Consumed)
+ 1 ${"content":"Green Power Crystal","class":"rs-darkorange"}$  (Consumed)
+ 1 ${"content":"Blue Power Crystal","class":"rs-darkorange"}$  (Consumed)
+ 1 ${"content":"Red Power Crystal","class":"rs-darkorange"}$  (Consumed)
+ 1 ${"content":"Dagger","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 8 Hours

The herbs, creatures, and crystals are all consumed and the enchanting stone becomes a corrupted stone. The bodies are consumed as well. Alters alignment towards evil.

DC${40,orange}$ Wisdom save to avoid corruption.

export.name: Necromancy: Soul Manipulation

A ${"content":"Blue Power Crystal","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ can added to attempt a DC${30,orange}$ Arcana check to control it.

+ 1 ${"content":"Fire Enchanting Stone","class":"rs-darkorange"}$

export.name: Travels: Crystalline Spider of Curell
export.description:
Having entered the cave, the group found the survivors and were confronted by a large spider whom they found to be named ${"content":"Cornoset","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

With ${"content":"Creara","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ helping, they attempted to sneak over to the cocooned people, but the spiders patrolling were too thick and a fight broke out.

While fighting they learned that ${"content":"Cornoset","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ was able to bend the some of the nearby crystals to his aid.

The fight proved difficulty but in the end, the spider was felled and the citizens cut down to be taken back.

export.name: Fish's Bet
export.description:
A simple card game created by fishermen. Supposedly based on haggling for the sale of their shipments of fish, it quickly picked up as a way to pass time and work on one's bluffing.

Each Player has 5 cards
Can ask questions:
+ How many (Pairs/Triplets/Quadruplets) do you have?
+/- 1
+ What is the total of your hand?
+/- 5
+ How many (Hearts/Diamonds/Spades/Clubs) do you have?
+/- 1
+ How many cards (Above/Below) (2-9) do you have?
+/- 1
+ How many (Black/Red) cards do you have?
+/- 2

The +/- range is how much you’re allowed to lie

Aces are always 1.

No Face Cards.

A triplet contains a pair, a quadruplet contains 2 pairs.

Regional variants exist to let you lie more, have more cards in hand, or limit the number of bets (Common in Casinos where the house then takes the pot).

export.name: Travels: The First Temple of Cthulhu
export.description:
Venturing out towards the temple across the plains, several scouts were observed a top the cliffs edge during the night as the group set out and made camp at night, managing to hide their pressence on the open plains. Climbing the cliff wall, they continued toward the temple and found several interesting points.

Aside from the temple itself, four Sheep pens to its West with only one pen holding any sheep pens, and a small corn field to its East with what appeared to be crystalline like corn husks. Ten guards patrolled or watched these various points of interest as the group planned how to attempt to deal with them.

Settling on attempting to distract the guards at the Sheep pen and lure them into a trap, success was found with a minicry sheep cry from ${"content":"Torrin","class":"rs-orange"}$ while an Illusionary spell from ${"content":"Orla","class":"rs-orange"}$ obscured one of the sheep. A guard was successfully lured out but managed to notice a lack of tracks into the forest. And while one guard was caught and killed, the other managed to alert the others.

In the fray, the guards dispersed, coming to help and one going into the Temple to get further assistance. One of the guards by the corn grabbed the ${"content":"Golden Husk","class":"rs-orange"}$ and ran ${"content":"South East","class":"rs-orange"}$ from the Temple, disappearing into the forest. Meanwhile, the other guard grabbed a ${"content":"Red Husk","class":"rs-orange"}$ and vanished from the group's sight.

Watching the ${"content":"Golden Husk","class":"rs-orange"}$ disappear into the forest, most of the group set off after it, everyone running at full pace and spreading out as the head Priest of the Temple, a Cleric or Paladin or some sort, came from the Temple accompanied by a two headed Orc.

Keeping their pace, the group continued toward the corn field as they lost sight of their two new foes, greeting them near the corn field as they broken their ${"content":"Invisibility","class":"rs-orange"}$ with surprise attacks against the divided group, joined by the guard from the corn field who's body seemed to merge with the crystal similar to when ${"content":"Xylaris","class":"rs-orange"}$ drank the ${"content":"Green Crystal Vial","class":"rs-orange"}$ but with more control.

As the group fought, ${"content":"Norwind","class":"rs-orange"}$ found every slash against his crystaline foe seemed to mirror to him. ${"content":"Xylaris","class":"rs-orange"}$ and ${"content":"Natty","class":"rs-orange"}$ finding themselves engaged with the Orc. In the meantime, ${"content":"Orla","class":"rs-orange"}$ bounced through the trees, making range for a few spells and ${"content":"Torrin","class":"rs-orange"}$ managed to kill and lay the final servant to rest and began to make his way over to the rest of the group.

${"content":"Norwind","class":"rs-orange"}$ found the upper hand against the crystalline servant despite the mirroring damage and on finishing him, the servant seemed to float momentarily before exploding. ${"content":"Natty","class":"rs-orange"}$ and ${"content":"Xylaris","class":"rs-orange"}$ managed to get the upper hand on the Orc with ${"content":"Orla's","class":"rs-orange"}$ help, leading the 2 leaders to retreat to within the Temple.

With the guards slain and the leaders in their temple, the group set out to attempt to to retrieve one of the corn husks, cutting a ${"content":"Red Husk","class":"rs-orange"}$ from its stalk from afar. They watched as it floated instead of falling, ducking to avoid what seemed to be a pending explosion, the entire field erupted as the other crystals exploded in the blast. The entire field now dust and ash, even deep into the ground, the roots seemingly lost as well.

Pushing forward they sought to get through the door and were met with a magical barrier that they managed to dispell and sneak into the temple. The first set of guards they came across seemed content with no one managing to enter the temple and did not notice thew group as they setup to kill the guards swiftly, one guard seeming to get some kind of call out but no one else seemed to come to his aid as the group finished him.

Continuing into the Temple, the group found a large room with several servants talking inside the room. An attempt to kill them and funnel them into the room seemed to fall short as small arcane toxic flowers started to grow in their rooms and release some kind of gas. Running through, the group found that the gas was quite toxic (${4d10,orange}$ Necrotic) and with an exploratory plan, threw a servant into the gas, and found that the servants seem unaffected by it.

Dispelling a flower and closing the door to the other room, they secured themselves from the other side and regrouped. Deep inside the Temple, they planned their next move...
