export.name: Revival of Cthulhu's Servant
export.description:
You've learned that the Servants of Cthulhu seem to be coming back to life as some kind of mindless husk after they die.

They appear to grapple their enemies and push raw necrotic energy into them (Causing ${3d10,orange}$ Necrotic Damage).

They appear to be capable of other things as well but ${Fire,orange}$ damage seems to be the bane of their weakness and they do not appear immune to being restrained.

export.name: Myth of the Mist Guard
export.description: Long thought to be the legend of a mythical beast that roams the southern tip of ${"content":"Lurus","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, ${"content":"Draconian","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ historians have determined that the myth is actually a reference to the guard for the ${"content":"Sword of the Mist","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, leading them to believe that the guard for the sword is somewhere in the southern part of ${"content":"Nautrengo","class":"rs-darkorange"}$'s empire on ${"content":"Lurus","class":"rs-darkorange"}$

export.name: Cthulhian Home in Tebit
export.description: You know of a home in Tebit that has wallpaper similar to design on the walls of one part of the ${"content":"Maze","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ in the Cthulhian Temple.
export.note: Belongs to Accucian Maelux, "friend" of Norwind who he "knows" from breaking into his house to steal stuff.

export.name: Travels: High Priest of Cthulhu
export.description:
Opening the door, they were face to face with the High Priest once again and the priest asked that ${"content":"Torrin","class":"rs-orange"}$ be handed over and that the rest of the party would be allowed to leave. ${"content":"Cthulhu","class":"rs-orange"}$ having apparently requested that his earlier work be finished, ${"content":"Torrin","class":"rs-orange"}$ having survived  his village's destruction. Several fell unconscious during the fight, but they managed to prevail, no one dying in the process.

After finishing the fight, the group found themselves in pain, and decided to try to leave the temple, but found a Dragon sitting outside the temple, eating sheep and later asleep. Deciding to avoid confrontentation with a Dragon in their state, they continued into the Temple. it seemed that the remaining acolytes had left, taking a number of things with them on their way out. Stumbling upon several mysteries in the Temple as well as a map.

+ A ${"content":"Shrine to Cthulhu","class":"rs-orange"}$ that asked for an offering with 3 bowls in front of it. Attempting to make an offering, their first offering of a ${"content":"Kintari Head","class":"rs-orange"}$ was absorbed and rejected. But 3 gold coins, 1 in each bowl was also absorbed but not rejected. But also not accepted.

+ A locked room with torches that used a ${"content":"Black Tar","class":"rs-orange"}$ to light the torches with a black flame. On entering the room, they found 2 ${"content":"Sending Stones","class":"rs-orange"}$ and a ritual book describing how to connect and disconnect the stones.

+ A mirror room with a puzzle using the crysals and casting various shadows onto the tiles. On matching the crystals to the tiles who had only one color cast on them, the main mirror became a portal and let the group into a ${"content":"Cthulhian Maze","class":"rs-orange"}$. In that maze they found several corners and prayers seemed to unlock portions of the maze. And deep in the Maze, 2 things were found: A storage window with a shield that after some work was solved, and a corner of the maze with wallpaper that seemed to have some signifigance but nothing was found there.

After finishing their exploration of the Temple, they left and attempted to burn it down, but found the building to be resistant enough to thwart their plan.

Finishing, they contemplated their next move from there...

export.name: Cthulhian Alter in Claruthano
export.description: Near the entrance to the ${"content":"Temple of Cthulhu","class":"rs-orange"}$ is a circular room with 3 bowls. While there, the alter merely asks, telepathically, for an offering.

export.name: Cthulhian Vault
export.description: Deep in the ${"content":"Temple of Cthulhu","class":"rs-orange"}$ is a room with large doors and torches on either side. Pouring ${"content":"Black Tar","class":"rs-orange"}$ into the torches and lighting them, a ${"content":"Black Flame","class":"rs-orange"}$ emerged and the doors unlocked.

export.name: The Desecrated Grounds on Claruthano
export.description:
The ${"content":"Cthulhian Temple","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ on ${"content":"Claruthano","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ sits on desecrated ground, serving as a refugee and opening for evil into the world.

Finding a PRiest or Cleric who can ${"content":"Hallow","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ the ground would likely be beneficial.

export.name: The Adult Black Dragon Phiur's Lair
export.description: You know where Phiur's lair is on the continent of ${Claruthano,orange}$

export.name: Travels: A Strange Portal
export.description:
With ${"content":"Cornoset","class":"rs-orange"}$ dead, the party was free to begin to free the civilians who he had kidnapped, and on reaching the collection of cocoons they found a great deal more cocoons than they expected. ${"content":"Lucy","class":"rs-orange"}$ and ${"content":"Ginnet","class":"rs-orange"}$ set about hauling the cocoons out of the cave while ${"content":"Creara","class":"rs-orange"}$ went back to town to get help moving the civilians.

Meanwhile, the others ventured deeper into the cave, finding pieces or spider droppings in the cave where ${"content":"Cornoset","class":"rs-orange"}$ seemed to sleep. Using ${"content":"Detect Magic","class":"rs-orange"}$ and scurrying through the area, ${"content":"Eldith","class":"rs-orange"}$ managed to find 4 ${"content":"Chips of Golden Crystal","class":"rs-orange"}$ that, while magical, are not active.

Deeper in the cave, they found a small room that sounded like a small distillery in the distance. with a few devices in the and investigated it further. The room contains a set of what look like steam pipes, ${"content":"Yellow Crystal Ball","class":"rs-orange"}$ mounted to a pedistool, 3 sets of 3 switches, and a wide golden plate in the corner. Looking around the room, the group found arcane sigils for 4 words:  
+ Dimension
+ Security
+ Hallway
+ Portal

Trying various switches, they learned that some combinations cause a hostile  ${"content":"Wrath","class":"rs-orange"}$ to show up, seemingly as a defensive measure. Also that turning all the switches to ${"content":"Green","class":"rs-green"}$ caused the Yellow Crystal Ball to glow and touching it with an ${"content":"Arcana","class":"rs-orange"}$ Check let someone see another realm. Setting them to ${"content":"Blue","class":"rs-blue"}$ however requested a word, and after a few failed attempts at other words, "Portal" opened a blue portal on the ${"content":"Golden Plate","class":"rs-orange"}$.

Going through the portal, the group found themselves in the other dimension they had seen before and after they entered, they tangled with another ${"content":"Wrath","class":"rs-orange"}$ which seemed much stronger in this realm than it did in the room, teleporting and seeming to have more powerful blades. But in either case, the swords seemed to dissipate.

Defeating the wrath and exploring, they found a vast number of platforms. Exploring, they found a portal at the edge of one of the platforms. ${"content":"Ash","class":"rs-orange"}$ stepped through and found himself in a kitchen and not able to go back through, though ${"content":"Eldith","class":"rs-orange"}$ and ${"content":"Quincy","class":"rs-orange"}$ could still see him. Deciding that more help might be needed for exploring this realm, ${"content":"Eldith","class":"rs-orange"}$ checking a portal on the opposite side of the platform as ${"content":"Quincy","class":"rs-orange"}$ left through the portal, closing it behind him.

When they got back, the cave was bustling with activity as people helped move the cocoons and many seemed to inspect the cave. A particiular politican caught the groups eye thouogh, and on getting back to town ${"content":"Ginnet","class":"rs-orange"}$ followed him around.

While they waited for the local militia to get the people out of cocoons, they all went into town and won a couple hundred gold in a game of ${"content":"Fish's Bet","class":"rs-orange"}$ while drinking in a near by bar and stuck around for the night. Their concerns for ${"content":"Ginnet","class":"rs-orange"}$ being relieved as the lightfooted halflight returned from his scouting, telling them of the politician's trip the Castle and then to what seemed to be his home for a boring night. After a few hours of drinking and eating, they managed to overhear a group of theives mention ${"content":"Qua Silverborn","class":"rs-orange"}$ having managed to survive an attack from assassins and that their might be good money in picking him up, supposedly he's hiding in ${"content":"Tebit","class":"rs-orange"}$.

Checking on the rescued people, they managed to find a tailor by the name of ${"content":"Holer","class":"rs-orange"}$ and his shop ${"content":"Holer's Civies","class":"rs-orange"}$ that's been empty for a year. Taking the opportunity they explored the shop and found nothing of particular interest but did find 3 receipts and what appeared to be a dress that ${"content":"Illerar","class":"rs-orange"}$ had purchased as a gift.

Deciding to leave the shop be, they went to talk to the council and were asked to help move some wolves to the North who had gotten slightly closer than the city would like and their group seemed better equipped to possibly move them peacefully...

export.name: Strange Song
export.description:
You've all found a note with a strange tune written on it...

Let go the strings  
The reigns of fate  
Follow the tracks  
And knock one back  
Seek with your mind  
And mind your eye  
The dark will hold  
The light will bind  
The shadow is kept...  
${"content":"Nigh Divine","class":"rs-red"}$

export.name: Travels: Sneaking through the Dragon's Lair
export.description:
Finding the entrance to the dragon's lair, the group managed kill several scorpians near the entrance without causing too much of a stir after grabbing the metal helm ${"content": "Frelsi","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ that granted interesting water exploration abilities. Before venturing further, they found a side entrance that seemed to lead into the lair but decided on the main entrance instead.

Sneaking deeper into the cave, they found a large opening with a mound in the middle and the dragon asleep atop it as well as a small lake and what seemed to be where the other entrance lead too. Looking around they managed to find a shield and ${"content": "Lemuli's Stones","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ across the lake. Sneaking deeper in, they grabbed the shield ${"content": "Bellescut","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and after discussing how to cross the water and using illusions to hide from the wandering scorpians, they used several ${"content": "Mutus Cancles","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ to move quietly and then deafen the dragon.

With the dragon unable to hear and asleep, the ${"content": "Norwind","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ managed to acquire the stones as the rest of the group worked their way around to the other side of the mound, finding an ${"content": "Arcane Tuned Mandolin","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ along the way. And after regrouping, they found a small tunnel where the scorpians had created a small nest with a faint blue glow coming out from under it. Sending ${"content": "Orla Jr. Jr.","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ sneaking down the tunnel as a cat, she managed to grab the necklace without drawing any attention.

Having burned almost 1 of their 3 hours of silence for the dragon, they sought to sneak out the side entrance in a bit of a rush. Getting somewhat lost in the side tunnels, ${"content": "Orla","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ went through all of her spell slots obscuring the group from the scorpians. Once out, they left a ${"content": "Cthulhian Pendent","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ in front of the Liar's main entrance as they took off into the night. Moving through the night and hiding in ${"content": "Leomund's Tiny Hut","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, they managed to avoid the dragon's search and get to the boat and out to sea, with their pouches filled to the brim, ${50000,orange}$ gold in the group. Which was promptly noticed by ${"content": "Po", "class": "rs-darkorange"}$ who deemed that the group should be able to buy the crossbow from ${"content": "Via","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ themselves.

Getting back to ${"content": "Dranous","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, the group returned ${"content": "Lemuli's Stones","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and set out to shopping, ${"content": "Orla","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ buying the book ${"content": "Shorarg","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ that she had so wanted.

While exploring, ${"content": "Xylaris","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ received some training on alchemy and can now easily find and identify various alchemical leaves and how to produce ${"content": "Healing Potions","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ using a ${"content": "Cauldron","class":"rs-darkorange"}$. ${"content": "Torrin","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ learned more about enchanting, learning how to create a ${"content": "Fire Enchanting Stone","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ with a standing offer from ${"content": "Braix","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ to learn other enchanting recipes such as ${"content": "Returning","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and ${"content": "Swiftness","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ for multiple attacks.

Inquiring about finding a ${"content": "Fire Elemental Core","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, ${"content": "Torrin","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ learned of ${"content": "Veren","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ in ${"content": "Alirans","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, a peculiar mage whose shop is always in the same spot but simply hard to identify.

Venturing across town looking for goods, many shops seemed depleted or attempting to restock as the empire set about funneling resources into the repair efforts. ${"content": "Xylaris","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ talking to ${"content": "Rieal","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ while looking for goods and learning that he had a ${"content": "Carriage","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ that he didn't have a use for anymore but couldn't sell for less than ${20000,orange}$ gold.

Wrapping up their shopping, the group reviewed their tasks and ${"content": "Norwind","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ remembering that he had business in ${"content": "Tebit","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ as well as that being where his friend with the mosaic like wallpaper lived.

While a handful of other tidbits litter the groups list of things to attend to, the main points of memory were...
 + ${"content": "Draconian Archeologists","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ believe the ${"content": "Hilt of the Mists","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ lies on the southern tip of ${"content": "Lurus","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, the continent of ${"content": "Nautrengo","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
 + The large demon from ${"content": "SaBrac","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ was seen in ${"content": "Dranous","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ around the same time as the assassin
 + The assassin with the shadowy crossbow is still alive and last seen in ${"content": "Dranous","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
 + The trio that ambushed the group in ${"content": "Tebit","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ is a mystery but still around and seemingly responsible for the ${"content": "Great Wyrm","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ living on ${"content": "Mikillabellera","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
 + ${"content": "Lucera","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ is in ${"content": "Tebit","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and there is another ${20000,orange}$ gold needed to purchase it from ${"content": "Via","class":"rs-darkorange"}$

export.name: Request: Binding a Demon
export.description:
In talking to ${"content": "Shorarg","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, you asked it about summoning and binding a Demon to you as a seemingly extra familiar.

While having one would reach the limits of your ability to tie creatures too you, the book seemed to think it was possible and is pondering the idea for you.

export.name: Request: Book for the Guild
export.description:
Having retrieved the ${"content": "The History of Vaminan Mathle","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ as requested, you must now return the book and your bracers ${"content": "Cieo","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ where you received the bracers in ${"content": "Tebit","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

Presumably the guild has some kind of pressence nearby.

export.name: Carriage for Sale
export.description: ${"content": "Rieal","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ is selling a carriage for ${20000,orange}$ gold. However he isn't willing to go any lower.

export.name: Alchemy: Fire Bomb
export.description:
You know how to create a ${"content":"Fire Bomb","class":"rs-darkorange"}$. The bomb can have varying effects if another ingredient is added. Adding other ingredients also increases the DC of the skill check.

Takes the below ingredients with an Alchemy Kit skill check at DC${10,orange}$+:
+ 1 ${"content":"Flask","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 2 ${"content":"Alchemy Ingredient Bundle","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 1 Optional Ingredient

export.name: Celebration: Rukurio
export.description:
A celebration of drinking and festivities celebrated everywhere, though each nation celebrates on a different week, all celebrate in the month of ${"content": "Comiaevum","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

The main event of the celebration is the ${"content": "Battle of Dominion","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, a celebration of the King's fight with the ${"content": "Blade of the Mists","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ where the hordes of demons attacking the cities were purged.

The battle entails a series of fights takes place in an arena against a summoned horde of demons. Your group must get a stone to the other end of the field while defending your end of the field from a similar attack. All while the attendees watch on from near by. A powerful wizard or warlock normally oversees the event and thus this celebration tends to only occur in the capitals of the empires, though towns have been known to hold small celebrates, usually challenging each other instead of using demons.

export.name: Alchemy: Potion of Divination
export.description:
You know how to create a ${"content":"Potion of Divination","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ allowing the one who consumes it to see some piece of the future to come.

Takes the below ingredients with an Alchemy Kit skill check at DC${35,orange}$:
+ 1 ${"content":"Flask","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 6 ${"content":"Alchemy Ingredient Bundle","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 3 ${"content":"Vials of Elemental Divine","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 2 ${"content":"Alupho Leaves","class":"rs-darkorange"}$

export.name: Alchemy: Potion of Sleep
export.description:
You know how to create a ${"content":"Potion of Sleep","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

Takes the below ingredients with an Alchemy Kit skill check at DC${15,orange}$:
+ 1 ${"content":"Flask","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 3 ${"content":"Alchemy Ingredient Bundle","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 2 ${"content":"Alupho Leaves","class":"rs-darkorange"}$

export.name: Alchemy: Potion of Cat's Grace
export.description:
You know how to create a ${"content":"Potion of Cat's Grace","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

Takes the below ingredients with an Alchemy Kit skill check at DC${15,orange}$:
+ 1 ${"content":"Flask","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 4 ${"content":"Alchemy Ingredient Bundle","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 1 ${"content":"Cat's Tail","class":"rs-darkorange"}$

export.name: Alchemy: Template
export.description:
You know how to create a ${"content":"Potion of Cat's Grace","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

Takes the below ingredients with an Alchemy Kit skill check at DC${15,orange}$:
+ 1 ${"content":"Flask","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 4 ${"content":"Alchemy Ingredient Bundle","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+

export.name: Alchemy: Potion of Owl's Intellect
export.description:
You know how to create a ${"content":"Potion of Owl's Intellect","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

Takes the below ingredients with an Alchemy Kit skill check at DC${15,orange}$:
+ 1 ${"content":"Flask","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 4 ${"content":"Alchemy Ingredient Bundle","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 1 bundle of ${"content":"Owl feathers","class":"rs-darkorange"}$

export.name: Alchemy: Potion of Water Breathing
export.description:
You know how to create a ${"content":"Potion of Water Breathing","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

Takes the below ingredients with an Alchemy Kit skill check at DC${15,orange}$:
+ 1 ${"content":"Flask","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 4 ${"content":"Alchemy Ingredient Bundle","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 1 ${"content":"Aigua Leaf","class":"rs-darkorange"}$

export.name: Alchemical Leaves
export.description: You've learned of the various leaves that can be found in nature that have alchemical properties used by alchemists.

export.name: Game: Battle of Dominion
export.description:
The main event of the ${"content": "Rukurio Celebration","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, the game is sometimes played outside of the celebration and every nation has slight changes to the rules.

In general, the battle entails a series of fights takes place in an arena against a summoned horde of demons. Your group must get a stone to the other end of the field while defending your end of the field from a similar attack. All while the attendees watch on from near by. A powerful wizard or warlock normally oversees the event and thus this celebration tends to only occur in the capitals of the empires, though towns have been known to hold small celebrates, usually challenging each other instead of using demons.

Each nation merely has different rules regarding the rocks, the demons summoned, and other such minor changes.

export.name: Game: Battle of Dominion (Tebit)
export.description:
The special rules of ${"content": "Tebit","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ involve the rocks. Any creature carrying the rocks is forced to pass a DC${15,orange}$ Wisdom save at the end of their turn or be driven ${"content": "Insane","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, causing them to lose their next turn as the idle, swaying in place.

While out of their mind, all attacks have advantage against them.

export.name: Game: Battle of Dominion (Leoterra)
export.description: The special rules of ${"content": "Leoterra","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ in general (Excluding Tebit) are that a team can only move its own rock.

export.name: Game: Battle of Dominion (Draconia)
export.description: The special rules of ${"content": "Draconia","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ are that the demons explode when killed, erupting in a firey blast and while you can move the demon's rock, it burns white hot, dealing ${2,orange}$d${6,orange}$ ${"content": "Fire","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ damage to any non-demonic creature carrying it.

export.name: Enchanting: Basic Stabilization
export.description:
You know how to protect pre-existing enchantments up to 2 pre-existing enchantments.

To stabilize 1 enchantment requires 25 Enchanting Herbs.

To stabilize 2 enchantments requires 100 Enchanting Herbs.

export.name: Travels: A House in Curell
export.description:
Having rescued and secured the citizens from the spider cove, the group set about attempting to persuade the wolves to the north to find another den as a favor to the ${"content":"Meisters","class":"rs-orange"}$ of ${"content":"Curell","class":"rs-orange"}$ for a small fee.

After some time speaking with the wolves while under ${"content":"Dionysus's Lush-filled Influence","class":"rs-orange"}$, ${"content":"Eldith","class":"rs-orange"}$ managed to convince them to seek out the ${"content":"Druids of the Shield","class":"rs-orange"}$ on the western coast as they may find good harbor there. Returning to the town, they received ${500,orange}$ gold from the ${"content":"Meisters","class":"rs-orange"}$ for having spoken to the wolves, seemingly pleased with the report they received but expecting a follow up or will at least be monitoring the situation.

With the wolf situation in motion, they sought out the healing civilians of whom they knew ${"content":"Holer","class":"rs-orange"}$ to be among them, having questions about his shop and tailoring. Speaking to ${"content":"Sergeant Obenier","class":"rs-orange"}$, everyone seemed to be on the mend.

On speaking with ${"content":"Holer","class":"rs-orange"}$ they learned that he had been detained in a box for several months before becoming cocooned. He seemed to be the odd one out from the others who were rescued as everyone else had only been missing for a few weeks at most whee as he had been missing for at least a year. He had no memory of being kidnapped or how he was disappeared, simply awaking in the box. Digging deeper into his past, the group also learned that he had made 3 odd robes that seemed to be for the ${"content":"Arcane Society","class":"rs-orange"}$ but were notably different, bearing an odd, but simple, shadow enchantment that caused the "AS" (For Arcane Society) to have a shadow that was always present and always at a specific slight angle. ${"content":"Holer","class":"rs-orange"}$ noted that it was odd, but not uncommon for there to be smaller distinguished groups from the society at large, having made several other robes for society members before, but never with the odd enchantment. The mystery of it seemed that this was the last order filled by him before disappearing. The group also remembering that ${"content":"Ilerar's Purchased Dress","class":"rs-orange"}$ for ${"content":"Itenysa Saene","class":"rs-orange"}$ was still present in the shop.

Leaving ${"content":"Holer","class":"rs-orange"}$ to rest so that he may re-open his shop soon, the group went to talk to the ${"content":"Meisters","class":"rs-orange"}$ about the odd building in the city limits that seemed to be with the ${"content":"Arcane Society","class":"rs-orange"}$. The council present noted that the ${"content":"Arcane Society","class":"rs-orange"}$ should have no pressence in the city and after some conversing, convinced them it was worth looking into the building at the least.

${"content":"Evan","class":"rs-orange"}$ and ${"content":"Avora","class":"rs-orange"}$ joined the group to investigate the building and the group was asked to wait outside as the ${"content":"Meisters","class":"rs-orange"}$ and several towns guard went in to speak with those inside. When they came out, the ${"content":"Meisters","class":"rs-orange"}$ were noticeable bothered and the guards simply returned to their posts. According to the ${"content":"Meisters","class":"rs-orange"}$ there building was within its rights to be in the city and they returned to the Castle. On asking the guards, they mentioned that some odd word was used that they didn't know but it seemed important.

Determined to investigate themselves, the group went back disguised as ${"content":"Meisters","class":"rs-orange"}$, ${"content":"Avora","class":"rs-orange"}$ and one whose name they knew not that was wearing a onesie at the time of their meeting. Impersonating the Pantsuit and the onesie in all, the group stealthily dispelled the ${"content":"Abjuration","class":"rs-orange"}$ and ${"content":"Divination","class":"rs-orange"}$ protection magics around the building to allow ${"content":"Eldith","class":"rs-orange"}$ and ${"content":"Ash","class":"rs-orange"}$ to teleport inside under guise. Collecting several large tombs while exploring the first floor and basement.

Once inside, they explored the building, sneaking around a lone night watchman who they came to learn was named ${"content":"Ordien","class":"rs-orange"}$. While inside, they encountered even more protection magics, but found their teleports to be useful in jumping floors to avoid the guard.

On the top floor, they found a large bed room and a locked closet area, both of whom were noticeably protected by magic. Exploring the bedroom first, they dispelled the ${"content":"Abjuration","class":"rs-orange"}$ protection magic, leaving  ${"content":"Divination","class":"rs-orange"}$, ${"content":"Transmutation","class":"rs-orange"}$, and ${"content":"Enchantment","class":"rs-orange"}$ magics around the room. Teleporting in blind, ${"content":"Ash","class":"rs-orange"}$ managed to land safely, but ${"content":"Eldith","class":"rs-orange"}$ was caught off guard by the small drop in the floor and tumbled making some noise but seeming to not disturb any of the visible sleeping creatures, of which they made one out to be a large red Dragonborn that seemed unfamiliar to them.

Looking around, ${"content":"Ash","class":"rs-orange"}$ spotted a pair of ${"content":"Fire Chains","class":"rs-orange"}$ on a nightstand next to a sleeping creature that was curled up under heavy blankets and hard to make out, but turned out to be awake, grabbing his hand as he attempted to grab the chains. While talking, they learned of the ${"content":"Rite of Curell","class":"rs-orange"}$ as the creature in the bed seemed to believe ${"content":"Ash","class":"rs-orange"}$ to be a ${"content":"Meister","class":"rs-orange"}$. However while conversing, the creature saw through the guise and began to stir along with a two-headed ogre on the other side of the room.

Deciding that there welcome had been overstayed, they bolted from the bedroom, leaving the rest of the group to quickly catch up and began to retreat down the alley. While running, they made out the red eyes of one that appeared to be a ${"content":"Tiefling","class":"rs-orange"}$, the eyes vaguely recognized by ${"content":"Ash","class":"rs-orange"}$, though the bright red glow was new and seemingly fleeting.

After wandering the town and determining that ${"content":"Ash","class":"rs-orange"}$ was marked for scrying, the mark was dispelled and they headed home...

export.name: Invoking the Rite of Curell
export.description: While the specifics of the rite may elude you, you know there is something to it that allows people to essentially do as they please in the city of ${"content":"Curell","class":"rs-orange"}$.

export.name: Specialty Arcane Society Robes made in Curell
export.description:
You've learned of special robes being made in ${"content":"Curell","class":"rs-orange"}$ by ${"content":"Couin Holer","class":"rs-orange"}$ that bore the mark of the ${"content":"Arcane Society","class":"rs-orange"}$ and had a special enchantment on the embroidery around the "AS" that gave a permanent and slightly angled shadow at all times.

While learning of it, ${"content":"Holer","class":"rs-orange"}$ mentioned that it wasn't uncommon for there to be special groups within the society but that in his years of making specialty robes for them off and on, he had never had one with any enchantment before that specific order. The last order he filled before he disappeared.

export.name: Holer's Civvies Maintenance
export.description: While he was out, ${"content":"Holer's Brother","class":"rs-orange"}$ keep the shop tidy and locked up. Though apparently never cleaned and didn't seem to handle finishing any orders as ${"content":"Ilerar's Purchased Dress","class":"rs-orange"}$ was still there.

export.name: The Arcanous Edous House in Curell
export.description: You've learned of a house that, after reading details inside the building, you've come to know is referred to as "Arcanous Edous" and it resides in ${"content":"Curell","class":"rs-orange"}$.

export.name: The Legend of Lucian's Spear
export.description:
It is said that while ${"content":"Lucian","class":"rs-orange"}$ may not walk ${"content":"Somincael","class":"rs-orange"}$, his spear does.

Not an instrument but a trio of loyal servants who carry out his will.

Not much is known of them but they certainly exist, a body count and ramblings following their wake if you look close enough.

export.name: Lucian's Spear
export.description:
Inquiring around the underworld, you've found information on the members of ${"content":"Lucian's Spear","class":"rs-orange"}$.

The seem to be charged with destabilizing the 4 great empires and have started with ${"content":"Leoterra","class":"rs-orange"}$ and ${"content":"Nautregno","class":"rs-orange"}$, knowing that the Orcish pride there in will spill over to the other nations, driving the world into a great war under which ${"content":"Lucian","class":"rs-orange"}$ will be able to find the ${"content":"Blade of the Mist","class":"rs-orange"}$ and enslave all of the planet.

export.name: Wraiths
export.description:
Capable of some flight, the deadliness of wraiths comes from their unusual strength for spirits, and their thirst to feed on souls.

Sometime found bound by wizards to be servants, these beings can be distinguished by the swords that are wielded when fighting instead of their claws, though the swords can sometimes be seen on their incorporeal forms.

export.name: Aid for the Brotherhood of Shararg in Curell
export.description:
Having served with them before, you know ${"content":"Lawama","class":"rs-orange"}$.

They requested your aid with a group of Mermaids to east and while helping them, ${"content":"Sita","class":"rs-orange"}$ and ${"content":"Sivo","class":"rs-orange"}$ drowning while fighting them, returning with the rest to ${"content":"Curell","class":"rs-orange"}$...

export.name: Travels: Return to tebit
export.description:
After a long journey and procuring ${"content":"Lemuli's Stones", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$, the group set off back to ${"content":"Dranous", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and returned the stones before they had previously set off toward Tebit.

Arriving in Tebit, the group learned of the ${"content":"Celebration of Rukurio", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ happening on the island as a celebration of the King's fight with the ${"content":"Blade of the Mist", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and ventured of to visit ${"content":"Via", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ while contemplating whether to join the celebration or not as they currently suspect they need to maintain a low profile in the city.

While at ${"content":"Via's", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$, ${"content":"Norwind", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ finally received his enchanted armor and had a few more enchantments added on, and the rest of the group likewise did some shopping with the skilled smithy to have many of their items improved.

Importantly while there, they acquired ${"content":"Lucera", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$, the crossbow created to balance the world from the creation of ${"content":"Harbinger", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and learned everything ${"content":"Via", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ knows of her monsterous creation.

Other important things of note were the costs of various enchantments they inquired about...
+ For ${"content":"500,000", "class":"rs-orange"}$G: Teleportation Enchantment to travel to any known teleportation circle
+ For ${"content":"40,000 + [Level of Spell Slot]^2 * 10,000", "class":"rs-orange"}$G: An additional spell slot of that level
+ For ${"content":"20,000", "class":"rs-orange"}$G: Succeed up to 2 saving throws
+ For ${"content":"1,000", "class":"rs-orange"}$G: Self Heating Cauldron
+ For ${"content":"1,000", "class":"rs-orange"}$G: For 1d6 Magical Damage
+ For ${"content":"900", "class":"rs-orange"}$G: For 1d6 Magical Resistance
+ For ${"content":"400", "class":"rs-orange"}$G: For 1d6 Physical Resistance

Additionally, for Via to enchant something that is already enchanted:
+ ${"content":"800", "class":"rs-orange"}$G Extra if 1 enchantment is present
+ ${"content":"8,800", "class":"rs-orange"}$G Extra if 2 enchantment are present 
+ ${"content":"30,000", "class":"rs-orange"}$G Extra if 3 enchantment are present
+ ${"content":"410,000", "class":"rs-orange"}$G Extra if 4 enchantment are present
+ ${"content":"1,500,000", "class":"rs-orange"}$G Extra if 5 enchantments are present or
+ ${"content":"590,000", "class":"rs-orange"}$G Extra if 5 enchantments are present with a 65% chance that it fails and makes the item inert.

Having returned and purchased several items from ${"content":"Via", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$, they managed a discount on a few items.

Finishing at ${"content":"Via's", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$, the group set off toward the fireworks at the festival and, after grabbing some delicious festival food, they signed up for the ${"content":"Battle of Dominion", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$, with a nice pair of gloves called ${"content":"Veneficium", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ as a reward for first place.

After signing up, they crawled into the stands and watched the groups before them to get a feel for the fight and received some wisdom from a random person near them regarding the fight. Working out a plan for moving their rock, they took the field and struggled against the demons that had been summoned for their match, but after a second wind from ${"content":"Torrin", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$, managed to gain a bit more time and move the rock just a little further. Finishing their match, and a bit broken from the fight, they took to the stands once again to watch the remaining groups.

Looking around, ${"content":"Norwind", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ caught sight of ${"content":"Cinia", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ waving to him from across the field and went over to catch up with his lost acquaintence. And shortly there after, the rest of the group spotted ${"content":"Arianya", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$, the one who had warned them of the secret society within the ${"content":"Arcane Society", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$, walking behind the stadium grabbing some food from a vendor's cart.

As night fell on the arena, the group contemplated their next move while also needing to pick up their prize from the wizards the next day...

export.name: Secret Society within the Arcane Society
export.description:
You've come to know of a secret society inside the ${"content":"Arcane Society", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ from ${"content":"Arianya Iprel", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ that appears to be seeking to kill millions of people using the ${"content":"Blade of the Mist", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$, ${"content":"Soul Gems", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$, and possibly other pieces.

She learned of it while taking over ${"content":"Sinda's", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ research, the one who informed you of the location of a ${"content":"Veldyr", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ on the island.

export.name: Odd Shopping Habits of Accucian
export.description: You've learned that ${"content":"Accucian Maelux","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ has an odd habit of buying 4 things from the store in quantities of 1, 7, 9, and 15...

export.name: The Library of Curell
export.description: You've learned of the library in ${"content":"Curell","class":"rs-orange"}$.

export.name: Basis of the Rite of Curell
export.description: You've learned that the ${"content":"Rite of Curell","class":"rs-orange"}$ has something to do with the founding of the city.

export.name: Access to the Library of Curell
export.description:
The city of ${"content":"Curell","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ has a library beneath its castle that contains historical books regarding the city and her people.

To access it, you need approval from 5 of the 9 ${"content":"Meisters of Curell","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

export.name: Shady Surveyor from the Spider Nest
export.description: Having followed a political prospector for the city of ${"content":"Curell","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ from the caves to his home, you know where he lives.

export.name: Ilerar's Crew
export.description: Having drunk a part of ${"content":"Ilerar's Crew", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and arm wrestled with ${"content":"Backshoo", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$, you have some general knowledge of the boatswains and some of the gunners aboard ${"content":"The Sepultura", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$

export.name: Location of the Sepultura
export.description: You've marked on your map the last place you knew of ${"content":"Ilerar", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$'s boat ${"content":"The Sepultura", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$.
export.note: Cardinal's Entry

export.name: Location of the Sepultura
export.description: You've marked on your map the last place you knew of ${"content":"Ilerar", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$'s boat ${"content":"The Sepultura", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$.
export.note: Raven's Entry

export.name: Tracking the Location of the Sepultura
export.description: Through magical means you're tracking the location of ${"content":"Ilerar", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$'s boat ${"content":"The Sepultura", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ on your map.

export.name: Travels: Waiting for Ilerar
export.description:
Having survived and escaped the seemingly adjacent ${"content":"Arcane Society","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ home found to be called ${"content":"Arcanous Edous","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ by a few notes scattered around the building, the group set off toward other goals, hoping to meet ${"content":"Ilerar","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ soon and find more information on the lady in red.

With a few days to kill before they expected to meet him, ${"content":"Eldith","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ set about reading the newly acquired books with ${"content":"Ginnet","class":"rs-darkorange"}$'s help as ${"content":"Lucy","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ drunken visited ${"content":"Holer's","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ in search of some new garments.  ${"content":"Ash","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, ${"content":"Quincy","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, and ${"content":"Zachariah","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ passed the time in the library.

After purchasing several pieces of clothing including a specialty order for a ${"content":"Shimmered Pantsuit","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, ${"content":"Lucy","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ oassed out in the changing room whilest the others finish exploring.

Those at the library learned a bit more on the ${"content":"Rite of Curell","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, specifically that it has something to do with the founding of the city and that the library does indeed know more about the history and procedures of the rites, but the information is only available to a select group of people that seems to at least reside on a list at the front desk of the library. And it would seem that access to the library requires the blessing of 5 of the 9 ${"content":"Meisters","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

Everyone wrapping up their tasks met at ${"content":"Holer's","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, ${"content":"Lucy","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ making her way out from the changing room just in time. As the group shopped, ${"content":"Ilerar","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ stepped into the shop, happy to see ${"content":"Holer","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ alive, well, and back in his shop. Apparently there to pick up an ordered dress, ${"content":"Ilerar","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ said hello but didn't seem to pay much attention to the group as they wondered about the shop.

${"content":"Pixie","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ tried to tail ${"content":"Ilerar","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ to maybe get more information but the pirates gave her the slip. Trying to find her way back she got lost but managed to get back to the room with ${"content":"Ginnet","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and wait for everyone to get back while helping him nurse his headache.

Exploring more after waiting for ${"content":"Pixie","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, the group found a party at the ${"content":"Temple to Dionysus","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ where apparently all the drinks were paid for by ${"content":"Ilerar","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ in celebration of a recent score, but the details of this score were expectedly absent.

Joining the festivities, ${"content":"Lucy","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ joined in the dancing, bringing a drunken ${"content":"Eldith","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ with her as the others scoped out the crowd for more information.

${"content":"Lucy","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and ${"content":"Eldith","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ managed to learn a bit about the crew of ${"content":"Ilerar's","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ boat ${"content":"The Sepultura","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ as they danced and ${"content":"Lucy","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ arm wrestled one ${"content":"Backshoo Uslaien","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, a Master Gunner on said boat from the ${"content":"Leoterran","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ city of ${"content":"Sancris","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

${"content":"Quincy","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ managed to find a group of other clerics and learned that ${"content":"Ilerar","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ is usually only in town maybe 3 to 5 times a year and that he had been in town 5 times in the last few moths to the cleric's knowledge. Though he seemed chilled to disclose it, he also mentioned having seen a woman in a strange amount of red being escorted into the city by ${"content":"Ilerar","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ only about a month back and her heading south in search of something that seemed to at least involve a boat, likely along the river a few days ride south of the city. After passing the information along, the cleric sulked out the back entrance, not eager to be seen, seemingly more scared of the ${"content":"Red Woman","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ than ${"content":"Ilerar","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

Wanting to get more information and determined to escalate the party to new levels, ${"content":"Lucy","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ packed her golden pipe full of ${"content":"Reefer Blend","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and filled the bar with smoke, hoping that a drug induced euphoria would make everyone more forthcoming with information. However, to her dismay, ${"content":"Ilerar","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and ${"content":"Itenysa","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ left as the smoke came in, seemingly happily changing to more intimate activities for the night. As they left, the group noticed that no one had been smoking while the pair were there and that seeing the smoke and their boss leave, many of the pirates pulled out their own pipes.

With the night coming to an end, the group headed back to the room and met up with ${"content":"Pixie","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and ${"content":"Ginnet","class":"rs-darkorange"}$. However there night was distrurbed by nightmares as they slept that night.

The next day was filled with research into the acquired books as they awaitied their meeting with ${"content":"Ilerar","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and the night was again frought with nightmares as the rested. Neither night denying them a long rest, but the nightmares disturbing none the less.

Looking through their room, they found that the books they had acquired seemed cursed to some degree, the book ${"content":"Okubi","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ mentioning in its forward that the arcane runes and sigils there in are known to cause nightmares to those around it and that care should be taken when handling it.

With the mystery of the nightmares solved and reading mostly accomplished, the group pondered what to do with their last dat before meeting ${"content":"Ilerar","class":"rs-darkorange"}$...

export.name: Cities of Nautregno
export.description: While on your map, you didn't really pay them much mind, but know you know more of the cities of Nautregno.

export.name: Alchemy: Waking Potion
export.description:
You know how to brew ${"content":"Waking Potion","class":"rs-darkorange"}$. When consumed, it removes the need for a full night's rest and protects the soul from disturbance, resulting in immunity to necrotic damage for the duration.

An Alchemy Kit Skill Check at DC55:
+ 1 ${"content":"Flask","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 2 ${"content":"Silver Crystal","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 15 ${"content":"Takn Leaf","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 300 ${"content":"Alchemy Ingredient Bundle","class":"rs-darkorange"}$

Alternatively, the Alchemy Kit skill check can be reduced to DC35 if the potions are brewed in a ${"content":"Cauldron","class":"rs-darkorange"}$. This style of brewing takes ${10 * (10-wis),orange}$ days and can only brew one potion. A flask is needed to collect the potion.
export.note: Can render a soul stone inert.

export.name: The Death of Qua Silverborn
export.description: You've learned that ${"content":"Qua Silverborn","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ died on the Northern tip of the continent of ${"content":"Lunderipio","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ while fleeing from the city of ${"content":"Intis","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

export.name: Contract: Indium Kidnapping
export.description: You've caught a glimpse of a contract to kidnap someone from ${"content":"Indium","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ in ${"content":"Lurus","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ who's associated with the ${"content":"Dream Review Office","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and bring them to ${"content":"Dens","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ in ${"content":"Lunderipio","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

export.name: Contract: Diplomatic Assassination
export.description: You know of a contract to assassinate diplomats from ${"content":"Draconia","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ in ${"content":"Coneixager","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ there to help with peace negotiations.

export.name: Contract: Guild Delivery to Sulendirida
export.description: You've been informed of a contract to move some crates from ${"content":"Tebit","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ to ${"content":"Northern Sulendirida","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

export.name: Contract: Guild Delivery to Neset, Lurus
export.description: You've been informed of a contract to smuggle some crates from ${"content":"Tebit","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ into ${"content":"Neset","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ in ${"content":"Lurus","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

export.name: Travels: Departing Tebit (Again)
export.description:
Leaving in the festival, the group picked up on them being followed and tried to get the jump on them but seemed to lose them in the crowd as they returned to the city, using its gate as a pinch point to hopefully catch their would be shadows. On not seeing anyone, they returned to the boat and spent the night in its safty, ${"content":"Natty","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ enjoying the comfort of ${"content":"Po","class":"rs-darkorange"}$'s specialty ${"content":"Hammock","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ spell.

In the morning, tensions were high as the usual shenanigan's ensued before they managed to discuss the day's plan to retrieve their prize and checking in on ${"content":"Norwind","class":"rs-darkorange"}$'s "friend". Deciding to try to check on the possible occultist first so as to be ready to make a quick exit after leaving the ${"content":"Arcane Society","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ Headquartersm the group set out into the city once again.

Reaching the "friend's" home and finding a crawl space into the back, finding an openning proved difficult in the middle of the day in which to get into the building, but talking to a noble woman walking the streets in search of her husband, they found out that one ${"content":"Accucian Maelux","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ lives in the house and that he has some "odd" shopping habits. However, given the trouble finding time to pick the lock, the group moved on to picking up their reward and then leaving quickly.

Once at the ${"content":"Arcane Society","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ headquarters, they retrieved their winnnings and spent some time looking around. ${"content":"Xylaris","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, ${"content":"Natty","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, and ${"content":"Norwind","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ spending some time in the lobby as they waited for ${"content":"Torrin","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ to finish looking around the library and for ${"content":"Orla","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ to finish talking to ${"content":"Penea","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, the head of the ${"content":"Arcane Society","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ about the state of her research, which seemed to need additional work before it would be accepted for a more full status in the society.

While in the lobby, the trio noticed a pair of people that seemed oddly similar to the pair that had appeared to be following them and ${"content":"Orla","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ had a quick brush with them but wasn't able to keep up with them to find out who they may have been.

Reconviening in the lobby, the group decided it was time to go and set off back to the boat.

Out to sea, the ${"content":"Sorafin","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ found itself in a skirmish with a teleporting pirate boat that managed to heavily damage their boat before the group managed to drive them off and repair their rudder to sail off. The damage leaving them with a choice between returning to ${"content":"Tebit","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ as the only near-by city able to repair them, or a long journey to the shores of ${"content":"Druteta","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ to retrieve needed wood and perform the repairs themselves. Not wanting to return to the city, they managed to sail to ${"content":"Druteta","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ without issues at sea.

With the island's shores in sight, they easily discovered why the island had been left to the wilds by the various empires...

export.name: The Rites of Curell
export.description:
A process by which those who played a large part in the original founding of the city of ${"content":"Curell","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ may use a magical binding to enchant a person with a message that can only be read by another who has the rites of ${"class":"rs-darkorange","content":"Curell"}$.

You've learned of 37 people who were part of the founding and that once someone becomes a ${"content":"Meister of Curell","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, they are given the ability to read them as well, however they are forever in a position of servitude to the city there after.

The process of the Rites is as such that the enchanted person never knows the message, though they may know a code word that can be spoken to unlock the message. Then someone with the rites can use their own Rites to read the enchantment.

Another creature can be granted the Rites if 8 other creatures with the Rites, and the knowledge, do so.

By the agreement within the Rites, the messages are never to be spoken.

The 37 Names noted with the Rites in ${"content":"Curell","class":"rs-darkorange"}$'s archives are as follows:
+ Onjur Cithums
+ Arango Okubumule
+ Sadrannturer Isabum
+ Crane Vox
+ Sarand Istren
+ Anameg Tullit
+ Stre Pisapo
+ Nang Ntumen

+ Bancrkho Cegqankw

+ Pelatu Mesarav
+ Celumab Celam
