You contact your deity or a divine proxy and ask up to ${wis/2 + 1,orange}$ questions (Increasing with Wisdom) that can be answered with a ${"content":"Yes", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$, ${"content":"No", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$, or ${"content":"Unclear", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$. You must ask your questions before the spell ends. You receive a correct answer for each question.

Divine beings aren’t necessarily omniscient, so you might receive ${"content":"Unclear", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ as an answer if a question pertains to information that lies beyond the deity’s knowledge. In a case where a one-word answer could be misleading or contrary to the deity’s interests, the GM might offer a short phrase as an answer instead.

If you cast the spell two or more times before finishing your next long rest, there is a cumulative ${25,orange}$ percent chance for each casting after the first that you get no answer. The GM makes this roll in secret.

export.name: Spell: Hallucinatory Terrain
export.description:
You make natural terrain in range look, sound, and smell like some other sort of natural terrain. Thus, open fields or a road can be made to resemble a swamp, hill, crevasse, or some other difficult or impassable terrain. A pond can be made to seem like a grassy meadow, a precipice like a gentle slope, or a rock-strewn gully like a wide and smooth road. Manufactured structures, equipment, and creatures within the area aren’t changed in appearance.

The tactile characteristics of the terrain are unchanged, so creatures entering the area are likely to see through the illusion. If the difference isn’t obvious by touch, a creature carefully examining the illusion can attempt an ${"content":"Investigation", "class":"rs-orange"}$ check against your spell save DC to disbelieve it. A creature who discerns the illusion for what it is, sees it as a vague image superimposed on the terrain.

export.name: Spell: See Invisibility
export.description: For the duration, you see invisible creatures and objects as if they were visible, and you can see into the  ${"content":"Ethereal Plane", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$. Ethereal creatures and objects appear ghostly and translucent.

export.name: Spell: Ray of Enfeeblement
export.description:
A black beam of enervating energy springs from your finger toward a creature within range. Make a ${"content":"Ranged Spell Attack", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ against the target. On a hit, the target deals only half damage with weapon attacks that use ${"content":"Strength", "class":"rs-orange"}$ until the spell ends.

At the end of each of the target’s turns, it can make a ${"content":"Constitution", "class":"rs-orange"}$ saving throw against the spell. On a success, the spell ends.

export.name: Spell: Phantasmal Killer
export.description: You tap into the nightmares of a creature you can see within range and create an illusory manifestation of its deepest fears, visible only to that creature. The target must make a ${"content":"Wisdom", "class":"rs-orange"}$ saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes frightened for the duration. At the end of each of the target’s turns before the spell ends, the target must succeed on a ${"content":"Wisdom", "class":"rs-orange"}$ saving throw or take 4d10 ${"content":"Psychic", "class":"rs-orange"}$ damage. On a successful save, the spell ends.

export.name: Spell: Locate Creature
export.description:
Describe or name a creature that is familiar to you. You sense the direction to the creature’s location, as long as that creature is within range of you. If the creature is moving, you know the direction of its movement.

The spell can locate a specific creature known to you, or the nearest creature of a specific kind (such as a human or a unicorn), so long as you have seen such a creature up close—within 15 studs—at least once. If the creature you described or named is in a different form, such as being under the effects of a ${"content":"Polymorph", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ spell, this spell doesn’t locate the creature.

This spell can’t locate a creature if running water at least ${5,orange}$ studs wide blocks a direct path between you and the creature.

export.name: Spell: Resilient Sphere
export.description:
A sphere of shimmering force encloses a creature or object of ${"content":"Large", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ size or smaller within range. An unwilling creature must make a ${"content":"Dexterity", "class":"rs-orange"}$ saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is enclosed for the duration.

Nothing—not physical objects, energy, or other spell effects—can pass through the barrier, in or out, though a creature in the sphere can breathe there. The sphere is immune to all damage, and a creature or object inside can’t be damaged by attacks or effects originating from outside, nor can a creature inside the sphere damage anything outside it.

The sphere is weightless and just large enough to contain the creature or object inside. An enclosed creature can use its action to push against the sphere’s walls and thus roll the sphere at up to half the creature’s speed. Similarly, the globe can be picked up and moved by other creatures.

A ${"content":"Disintegrate", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ spell targeting the globe destroys it without harming anything inside it.

export.name: Spell: Private Sanctum
export.description:
You make an area within range magically secure. The area is a cube that can be as small as ${5,orange}$ studs to as large as ${50,orange}$ studs on each side. The spell lasts for the duration or until you use an ${"content":"Action", "class":"rs-orange"}$ to dismiss it.

When you cast the spell, you decide what sort of security the spell provides, choosing any or all of the following properties:
+ Sound can’t pass through the barrier at the edge of the warded area.
+ The barrier of the warded area appears dark and foggy, preventing vision (including darkvision) through it.
+ Sensors created by divination spells can’t appear inside the protected area or pass through the barrier at its perimeter.
+ Creatures in the area can’t be targeted by divination spells.
+ Nothing can teleport into or out of the warded area.
+ Planar travel is blocked within the warded area.

Casting this spell on the same spot every day for a year makes this effect permanent.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can increase the size of the cube by ${50,orange}$ studs for each slot level beyond 4th. Thus you could protect a cube that can be up to ${100,orange}$ studs on one side by using a spell slot of 5th level.

export.name: Spell: Polymorph
export.description:
This spell transforms a creature that you can see within range into a new form. An unwilling creature must make a ${"content":"Wisdom", "class":"rs-orange"}$ saving throw to avoid the effect. The spell has no effect on a shapechanger or a creature with 0 hit points.

The transformation lasts for the duration, until the target drops to 0 hit points, or the target dies. The new form can be any non-magical beast whose ${"content":"Size", "class":"rs-orange"}$ is the same or less than the target's. The target’s game statistics, including mental ability scores, are replaced by the statistics of the chosen beast. It retains its alignment and personality.

The target assumes the hit points of its new form. When it reverts to its normal form, the creature returns to the number of hit points it had before it transformed. If it reverts as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to its normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn’t reduce the creature’s normal form to 0 hit points, it isn’t knocked unconscious.

The creature is limited in the actions it can perform by the nature of its new form, and it can’t speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech.

The target’s gear melds into the new form. The creature can’t activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.

export.name: Spell: Cloudkill
export.description:
You create a sphere of poisonous, yellow-green fog centered on a point you choose within range. The fog spreads around corners. It lasts for the duration or until strong wind disperses the fog, ending the spell. 

The area is heavily obscured.

When a creature enters the spell’s area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a ${"content":"Constitution", "class":"rs-orange"}$ saving throw. The creature takes 5d8 ${"content":"Poison", "class":"rs-orange"}$ damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Creatures are affected even if they hold their breath or don’t need to breathe. The fog moves ${5,orange}$ studs away from you at the start of each of your turns, rolling along the surface of the ground. The vapors, being heavier than air, sink to the lowest level of the land, even pouring down openings.

export.name: Spell: Conjure Elemental
export.description:
You call forth an elemental servant.

Choose an area of air, earth, fire, or water that fills a 5-stud cube within range. An elemental of ${"content":"Threat", "class":"rs-orange"}$  rating 5 or lower appropriate to the area you chose appears in an unoccupied space within 5 studs of it.

For example, a fire elemental emerges from a bonfire, and an earth elemental rises up from the ground.

The elemental disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends. The elemental is friendly to you and your companions for the duration. Roll initiative for the elemental, which has its own turns. It obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you). If you don’t issue any commands to the elemental, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions. If your concentration is broken, the elemental doesn’t disappear. Instead, you lose control of the elemental, it becomes hostile toward you and your companions, and it might attack. An uncontrolled elemental can’t be dismissed by you, and it disappears ${1,orange}$ hour after you summoned it. The GM has the elemental’s statistics.

**At Higher Levels**: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the ${"content":"Threat", "class":"rs-orange"}$ rating increases by 1 for each slot level above 5th.

export.name: Spell: Contact Other Plane
export.description:
You mentally contact a demigod, the spirit of a long-dead sage, or some other mysterious entity from another plane. Contacting this extraplanar intelligence can strain or even break your mind. When you cast this spell, make an ${"content":"Intelligence", "class":"rs-orange"}$ DC${15,orange}$ saving throw. On a failure, you take 6d6 ${"content":"Psychic", "class":"rs-orange"}$ damage and are ${"content":"Insane", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ until you finish a long rest. While ${"content":"Insane", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$, you can’t take actions, can’t understand what other creatures say, can’t read, and speak only in gibberish. A greater restoration spell cast on you ends this effect.

On a successful save, you can ask the entity up to five questions. You must ask your questions before the spell ends. The GM answers each question with one word, such as "yes", "no", "maybe", "never", "irrelevant", or "unclear" (if the entity doesn’t know the answer to the question). If answering does against the creature's motiviations or goals, it may lie, which can be detected with a successful ${"content":"Insight", "class":"rs-orange"}$ check against that creature's ${"content":"Deception", "class":"rs-orange"}$. But unless directly against that creature's interests, it will answer truthfully. If a one-word answer would be misleading, the GM might instead offer a short phrase as an answer.

export.name: Spell: Awaken
export.description:
After spending the casting time tracing magical pathways within a precious gemstone, you touch a Huge or smaller beast or plant. The target must have either no Intelligence score or an Intelligence below your of ${"content":"Wisdom", "class":"rs-orange"}$ Modifier (${wis,orange}$). The target gains an ${"content":"Intelligence", "class":"rs-orange"}$ of ${10,orange}$. The target also gains the ability to speak one language you know. If the target is a plant, it gains the ability to move its limbs, roots, vines, creepers, and so forth, and it gains senses similar to a human’s. Your GM chooses statistics appropriate for the awakened plant, such as the statistics for the awakened shrub or the awakened tree.

The awakened beast or plant is charmed by you for the duration or until you or your companions do anything harmful to it. When the charmed condition ends, the awakened creature chooses whether to remain friendly to you, based on how you treated it while it was charmed.

export.name: Spell: Wall Of Fire
export.description:
You create a wall of fire on a solid surface within range. You can make the wall up to ${30,orange}$ studs long, ${10,orange}$ studs high, and ${1,orange}$ stud thick, or a ringed wall up to ${10,orange}$ studs in diameter, ${10,orange}$ studs high, and ${1,orange}$ stud thick.

The wall is opaque and lasts for the duration.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a ${"content":"Dexterity", "class":"rs-orange"}$ saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 5d8 ${"content":"Fire", "class":"rs-orange"}$ damage, or half as much damage on a successful save.

One side of the wall, selected by you when you cast this spell, deals damage to each creature that ends its turn within ${5,orange}$ studs of that side or inside the wall. A creature takes the same damage when it enters the wall for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. 

The other side of the wall deals no damage.

export.name: Spell: Fire Shield
export.description:
Thin and wispy flames wreathe your body for the duration, shedding bright light in a ${5,orange}$ stud radius and dim light for an additional ${5,orange}$ studs. You can end the spell early by using an action to dismiss it.

The flames provide you with one of the following:
+ ${"content":"Warm Shield", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$
	+ Reduces ${"content":"Cold", "class":"rs-orange"}$ damage by 4d8
	+ Creatures making melee attacks against you without reach take 2d8 ${"content":"Fire", "class":"rs-orange"}$ damage
+ ${"content":"Chill Shield", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$
	+ Reduces ${"content":"Fire", "class":"rs-orange"}$ damage by 4d8
	+ Creatures making melee attacks against you without reach take 2d8 ${"content":"Cold", "class":"rs-orange"}$ damage

export.name: Spell: Fabricate
export.description:
You convert raw materials into products of the same material. For example, you can fabricate a wooden bridge from a clump of trees, a rope from a patch of hemp, and clothes from flax or wool.

Choose raw materials that you can see within range. You can fabricate an object contained within a cube of ${int,orange}$ studs on each side (Increases with your ${"content":"Intelligence", "class":"rs-orange"}$ modifier), given a sufficient quantity of raw material. The quality of objects made by the spell is commensurate with the quality of the raw materials.

Creatures or magic items can’t be created or transmuted by this spell. You also can’t use it to create items that ordinarily require a high degree of craftsmanship, such as jewelry, weapons, glass, or armor, unless you have proficiency with the type of artisan’s tools used to craft such objects.

export.name: Spell: Faithful Hound
export.description:
You conjure a phantom watchdog in an unoccupied space that you can see within range, where it remains for the duration, until you dismiss it as an action, or until you move more than ${100,orange}$ studs away from it.

The hound is invisible to all creatures except you and can’t be harmed. When a Small or larger creature comes within ${15,orange}$ studs feet of it without first speaking the password that you specify when you cast this spell, the hound starts barking loudly. The hound sees invisible creatures and can see into the Ethereal Plane. It ignores illusions.

At the start of each of your turns, the hound attempts to bite one creature within ${5,orange}$ studs of it that is hostile to you. For the attack, roll a ${"content":"Spell Attack", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$. On a hit, it deals 4d8 ${"content":"Piercing", "class":"rs-orange"}$ damage.

The hound does not move from its summoned location except to attack a creature within its range.

export.name: Spell: Death Ward
export.description:
You touch a creature and grant it a measure of protection from death.

The first time the target would drop to 0 hit points as a result of taking damage, the target instead drops to 1 hit point, and the spell ends.

If the spell is still in effect when the target is subjected to an effect that would kill it instantaneously without dealing damage, that effect is instead negated against the target, and the spell ends.

export.name: Spell: Conjure Minor Elementals
export.description:
You summon elementals that appear in unoccupied spaces that you can see within range. You choose one the following options for what appears:
+ One elemental of ${"content":"Threat", "class":"rs-orange"}$ rating 3 or lower
+ Two elementals of ${"content":"Threat", "class":"rs-orange"}$ rating 2 or lower
+ Four elementals of ${"content":"Threat", "class":"rs-orange"}$ rating 1 or lower
+ Eight elementals of ${"content":"Threat", "class":"rs-orange"}$ rating 0

You must know of an elemental that fits the needed class to use it. See your ${"content":"Knowledge", "class":"rs-orange"}$ page and sort by ${"content":"Threat", "class":"rs-orange"}$.

An elemental summoned by this spell disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends. The summoned creatures are friendly to you and your companions. Roll initiative for the summoned creatures as a group, which has its own turns. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don’t issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions. The GM has the creatures’ statistics.

While casting, you can not move.

**At Higher Levels**: When you cast this spell using certain higher-level Spell Slots, you choose one of the summoning options above, and more creatures appear - twice as many with a 6th-level slot and three times as many with an 8th-level slot

export.name: Spell: Detect Thoughts
export.description:
For the duration, you can read the thoughts of certain creatures. When you cast the spell and as your action on each turn until the spell ends, you can focus your mind on any one creature that you can see within range of you. If the creature you choose has an ${"content":"Intelligence", "class":"rs-orange"}$ below ${3,orange}$ or doesn’t speak any language, the creature is unaffected.

You initially learn the surface thoughts of the creature—what is most on its mind in that moment. As an action, you can either shift your attention to another creature’s thoughts or attempt to probe deeper into the same creature’s mind. If you probe deeper, the target must make a ${"content":"Wisdom", "class":"rs-orange"}$ saving throw. If it fails, you gain insight into its reasoning (if any), its emotional state, and something that looms large in its mind (such as something it worries over, loves, or hates). If it succeeds, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and unless you shift your attention to another creature’s thoughts, the creature can use its action on its turn to make an ${"content":"Intelligence", "class":"rs-orange"}$ check contested by your ${"content":"Intelligence", "class":"rs-orange"}$ check; if it succeeds, the spell ends.

Questions verbally directed at the target creature naturally shape the course of its thoughts, so this spell is particularly effective as part of an interrogation.

You can also use this spell to detect the presence of thinking creatures you can’t see. When you cast the spell or as your action during the duration, you can search for thoughts within range of you. The spell can penetrate barriers, but ${1,orange}$ stud of rock, ${1/3,orange}$ a block of any metal other than lead, or a thin sheet of lead blocks you. You can’t detect a creature with an ${"content":"Intelligence", "class":"rs-orange"}$ of ${3,orange}$ or lower or one that doesn’t speak any language.

Once you detect the presence of a creature in this way, you can read its thoughts for the rest of the duration as described above, even if you can’t see it, but it must still be within range.

export.name: Spell: Find Steed
export.description:
You summon a spirit that assumes the form of an unusually intelligent, strong, and loyal steed, creating a long-lasting bond with it. Appearing in an unoccupied space within range, the steed takes on a form that you choose: a warhorse, a pony, a camel, an elk, or a mastiff. (Your GM might allow other animals to be summoned as steeds.) The steed has the statistics of the chosen form, though it is a celestial, fey, or fiend (your choice) instead of its normal type. Additionally, if your steed has an ${"content":"Intelligence", "class":"rs-orange"}$ of 5 or less, its ${"content":"Intelligence", "class":"rs-orange"}$ becomes 6, and it gains the ability to understand one language of your choice that you speak.

Your steed serves you as a mount, both in combat and out, and you have an instinctive bond with it that allows you to fight as a seamless unit. While mounted on your steed, you can make any spell you cast that targets only you also target your steed.

When the steed drops to 0 hit points, it disappears, leaving behind no physical form. You can also dismiss your steed at any time as an ${"content":"Action", "class":"rs-orange"}$, causing it to disappear. In either case, casting this spell again summons the same steed, restored to its hit point maximum.

While your steed is within 1 mile of you, you can communicate with it telepathically.

You can’t have more than one steed bonded by this spell at a time. As an ${"content":"Action", "class":"rs-orange"}$, you can release the steed from its bond at any time, causing it to disappear.

export.name: Travels: The Endless Well
export.description:
Waking in the camp, the group was greeted by ${"content":"Lucy","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, having grown bored waiting for them on the boat, and with everyone present, they set off to explore the other caves. Venturing around the remaining caves in the area, there wasn't much of interest. The final cave showing a few hungry spiders that were generally easily dispatched. Looking over the cave area, they decided that they had covered as much of the area as was reasonable without digging and that an investigation of the other location seemed warranted before heading back to Tebit.

Reaching the other location that ${"content":"Via","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ had marked on their map, they found an oddly placed ${"content":"Well","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ atop the mountains. Investigating, they saw no bottom and looking around, saw no clues as to its purpose or how to approach it. Cautiously, they sent ${"content":"Pixie","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ to fly down and investigate. Her first trip took 30 minutes for her to go down and come back, not seeing anything on her way or finding a bottom. Sending her for another trip, several hours this time, she managed to catch a glimpse of an illusion somewhere along the side of the ${"content":"Well","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, but as all the sides were smooth and a repeating pattern, she couldn't make out where she had seen it and from her speed couldn't make out how far down she was when she saw it.

Contemplating some possible solutions, ${"content":"Eldith","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ toyed with some possible solutions for them to go down and look, their best option seemingly being the ${"content":"Witch's Broom","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ they found from earlier. While hard to use, it made for a decent vessel. Managing to activate the broom, she and ${"content":"Ginnet","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ set off down the ${"content":"Well","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ in search of ${"content":"Pixie","class":"rs-darkorange"}$'s illusion, making note to start heading back up after 25 minutes as the broom's flight only lasts for an hour.

Distracted by the repeating patterns and losing track of her ${"content":"Detect Magic","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ from the lack of any magic in or on the walls of the well, the pair descended for longer than they meant. As they went to return, they found themselves a few hundred studs short of the entrance, holding on to the sides as neither had ${"content":"Fly","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ by scroll or book. Yelling above to get anyone's attention, ${"content":"Ginnet","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ managed to create a small handhold with a ${"content":"Potion of Dissolution","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, both managing to keep the broom in their hands as their momentum came to a halt.

Catching ${"content":"Eldith","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ after she lost her grip, she and ${"content":"Ginnet","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ clung to the wall, continuing to yell for help. Barely hearing their faint screams in the distance, ${"content":"Ash","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ headed over and after some quick thinking, used fly to go down and bring the pair back up. Recomposing themselves, they decided to keep the ${"content":"Well","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ in mind and headed back to ${"content":"Cotens","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

Once back, the regiment assigned to them dispersed and wished them luck. As most of the group headed back toward their boat, ${"content":"Ginnet","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ went in search of the ${"content":"Expedition Registry","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ for possible answers to the owner of the ${"content":"Ripped and Tattered Heavy Coat","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, but found himself thwarted by guards and a locked door. However, Captain ${"content":"Baydel Sajie","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ has the registry in his office and it is not likely to leave ${"content":"Cotens","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ for several months, if not years.

Departing ${"content":"Cotens","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ for ${"content":"Tebit","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ was a simple journey and they took some time to pick up their goods from ${"content":"Animous Maevion","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, a ${"content":"Decorative Flute","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ for ${"content":"Ginnet","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and a ${"content":"Simple Bag of Holding","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ for ${"content":"Eldith","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and do some other shopping around the area. With the general shopping completed, they ventured down to visit ${"content":"Via","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and give her ${"content":"Athena's Blessing","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ for the relic she had requested.

Quite satisfied with the ${"content":"Holy Relic","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ they bought her, she returned the ${"content":"Divine Blue Power Crystal","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ they had given the assistant at the front desk several days ago and informed them she'd be happy to help them with their gear.

After some discussion, ${"content":"Lucy","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ had her bracers upgraded to double their strength and their risk for 3000${"content":"G","class":"rs-yellow"}$, noting that it could be doubled again for another 8000${"content":"G","class":"rs-yellow"}$ and a few other notable prices:
 + 1000${"content":"G","class":"rs-yellow"}$ to Unattune the bracers
 + 1000${"content":"G","class":"rs-yellow"}$ to completely remove the enchantment from the bracers
 + 1000${"content":"G","class":"rs-yellow"}$ and 3 days to train in the use of the ${"content":"Corruption Stone","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
    + Would still need to buy additional materials for the ritual that would likely come to around 700 to 800 gold
 + 10000${"content":"G","class":"rs-yellow"}$ to tweak ${"content":"Icy Presence","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
    + Control the mist effect
	+ Improve Icebolt to a d12 and give it charges for use
	+ Tweak the mist to occasionally slow or damage near-by creatures at random
 + Buy Chunks of ${"content":"Red","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, ${"content":"Blue","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, or ${"content":"Green","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ Power Crystal Ore for 450${"content":"G","class":"rs-yellow"}$

With her usual interest in art, ${"content":"Lucy","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ also inquired about selling her "acquired" art and a good ${"content":"Pantsuit","class":"rs-darkorange"}$. Learning that art is best sold in the capitals where a good collector can be found, and that the best pantsuit that ${"content":"Via","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ knows of resides in ${"content":"Indium","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ with Queen ${"content":"Flaurer Isist","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, which was coincidentally also made by ${"content":"Holer","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ back before he disappeared to ${"content":"Curell","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and opened ${"content":"Holer's Civvies","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ in the town. And long before he was kidnapped and ended up in a spider web.

Leaving ${"content":"Via's Smithery","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, they started to get ready to leave, but ${"content":"Quincy","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ hoped to head to the ${"content":"Temple of Serinal","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ to pray to ${"content":"Dionysus","class":"rs-darkorange"}$before they left. On their way, ${"content":"Ash","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and ${"content":"Ginnet","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ felt a warmth, but it seemed to maybe just be the weather or the result of some experiment in the area, but they continued on to the temple slight more alert. Once at the temple, the group remembered their ${"content":"Small Golden Locket","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ which ${"content":"Father Agonya","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ fixed as ${"content":"Quincy","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ prayed. And while ${"content":"Quincy","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ heard no answer, he felt that he was heard himself and felt that his tasks in the temple were complete.

As they left the temple, ${"content":"Eldith","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ noted that she wanted to stop by the library for any possible help as well before they headed East to ${"content":"Sulendirida","class":"rs-darkorange"}$...

export.name: Owner of a Tattered Heavy Coat
export.description: While following ${"content":"Via","class":"rs-darkorange"}$'s directions to suspected ancient temples to find ${"content":"Holy Relics","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ in ${"content":"Mikillabellera","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ on ${"content":"318 Borgevum 5","class":"rs-lightblue"}$ ${"content":"Session 31","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, the group found loose threads in a seeming temple to ${"content":"Athena","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ where they suspect a holy relic should have been. Subsequently during their explorations, on ${"content":"318 Borgevum 8","class":"rs-lightblue"}$ ${"content":"Session 32","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, a ${"content":"Ripped and Tattered Heavy Coat","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ was found that seemed to match the threads they had found in a cave that eventually lead to an unopened storage room of some kind. The easiest way to ascertain the owner of the coat, and the holy relic, seems to be the ${"content":"Expedition Registry","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ in ${"content":"Cotens","class":"rs-darkorange"}$. --- On ${"content":"318 Borgevum 14","class":"rs-lightblue"}$ ${"content":"Session 33","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, ${"content":"Ginnet","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ tried to steal the registry but was foiled by the buildings security. But the registry will likely be in ${"content":"Cotens","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ for several months, if not years, before being sent back to ${"content":"Montis","class":"rs-darkorange"}$. --- On 318 Unkulevum 16Session 33 you learned more about the owner after Quincy used the piece of the coat in a casting of Legend Lore learning that the Tiefling in Curell was the owner of the cloak and that Holler did indeed create it some time ago. In his vision of the legend of the coat, he saw the tiefling casting seemingly high level magic with an assortment of Power Crystals orbiting around her arm as she seemed to travel the world. From his visions, the tiefling presumably still has the coat.

export.name: Bottomless Well
export.description: One of the possible sunken temple locations pointed out by ${"content":"Via","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ in Northern ${"content":"Mikillabellera","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ has a seemingly bottomless well that ${"content":"Pixie","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ has confirmed has an illusion somewhere along the side of the seemingly endless wall.

export.name: Glorious Pantsuit in Indium
export.description:
You've learned from ${"content":"Via", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ that the most glorious ${"content":"Pantsuit", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ that she knows of was made by ${"content":"Holer", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and is in ${"content":"Indium", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ under the care of the Elven Queen ${"content":"Flaurer Isist", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

${"content":"Via", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ mentioned that the ${"content":"Flaurer", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ is a fashionable queen and commonly sells her excess clothes to raise money or awareness for those in need, but if ${"content":"Flaurer", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ knows that ${"content":"Holer", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ has essentially retired, then she will likely keep the ${"content":"Pantsuit", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ for its rarity.

That said however, ${"content":"Via", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ recalls ${"content":"Holer", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$'s work from his time in ${"content":"Flucris", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ being exceptional and there are likely more Suits, Dresses, and Pantsuits out there that some may part with for the right amount.

export.name: Alchemy: Poison Potion
export.description:
You know how to brew a ${"content":"Poison Potion","class":"rs-darkorange"}$. It can be used to coat weapons in poison or as part of poisonous enchantments.

An Alchemy Kit Skill Check at DC20:
+ 1 ${"content":"Flask","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 1 ${"content":"Poisonous Plant","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 3 ${"content":"Alchemy Ingredient Bundle","class":"rs-darkorange"}$

Alternatively, the Alchemy Kit skill check can be reduced to DC7 if the potions are brewed in a ${"content":"Cauldron","class":"rs-darkorange"}$. This style of brewing takes ${2/wis,orange}$ days per potion brewing. A flask is needed to collect the potion. The maximum number of potions varies with the size of the cauldron.

export.name: Alchemy: Spell Ink
export.description:
You know how to brew a ${"content":"Spell Ink","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, used in ${"content":"Spell Copying Inkwells","class":"rs-darkorange"}$. This must be brewed inside a ${"content":"Cauldron","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ with some source of heat.

An ${"content":"Alchemy Kit","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ Skill Check starting at DC${5,darkorange}$ and requires a ${"content":"Cauldron","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and ${15,orange}$ minutes:
+ 1 ${"content":"Takn Leaf","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 4 ${"content":"Alchemy Ingredient Bundle","class":"rs-darkorange"}$

Depending on the success of the ${"content":"Alchemy Kit","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, the brewing will yield enough ink for 5 to 15 inkwells.
+ Roll of ${5,darkorange}$ yields5 Inkwells worth of ink
+ Roll of ${10,darkorange}$ yields 7 Inkwells worth of ink
+ Roll of ${15,darkorange}$ yields 9 Inkwells worth of ink
+ Roll of ${20,darkorange}$ yields 11 Inkwells worth of ink
+ Roll of ${25,darkorange}$ yields 13 Inkwells worth of ink
+ Roll of ${30,darkorange}$ yields 15 Inkwells worth of ink

export.name: Portal to Reykurax
export.description:
${"content":"Simer","class":"rs-darkorange"}$'s place in the world makes it easy for portals to other realms to open there.

Due to circumstances, a portal to ${"content":"Reykurax","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ exists in a cavern under the market square.

export.name: Realm Portals
export.description:
Portals to other realms can be opened through magic and sometimes from seemingly natural forces.

These portals tend to be stable but can sometimes only allow travel in one way; Either in or out.

export.name: The City of the Dead: Stjornu
export.description:
The realm of the lingering souls, ${"content":"Reykurax","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ has one lone city that is known to be, ${"content":"Stjornu","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

The city resides in what is considered the middle of the sole known landmass where the souls of the dead linger in a lost ethereal form, but they usual avoid the mountains where the mist seems to fall from.

${"content":"Stjornu","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ sits in the mountains and has several roads that lead out through the mountain passes around it.

And while the realm can be explored, there is nothing considered to be of note out in the mist.

export.name: Travels: Love and Navigation
export.description:
Wandering in the cold mist, the group continued to seek some kind of grounding. Looking to keep the group protected from the biting cold, ${"content":"Orla","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ grabbed a few stones and warmed them using ${"content":"Prestidigitation","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, handing several out to each of the members of the group so that they may huddle them under their coats. As she warmed the last few stones, a great voice called out to them, clearing a small opening in the mist and revealing himself to be the guardian of a piece of the ${"content":"Sword of the Mist","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

As the mist cleared in their midsts, an unusually normal human walked forth, donning a straw hat that was eriely similar to ${"content":"Po's","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, and a giant sword on his back. They all spoke briefly and the guardian noted that they seemed worthy, if not yet ready for the trials ahead. Noting that they did not seem to understand him when he spoke ${"content":"Ancient","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ but that they seemed to have a greater fate than they may realize. And while he appreciated their intentions and the extent of their destiny, he could not simply hand over the piec, that the ritual demanded that combat ensue for them to earn the piece they sought.

The fight that ensued was difficult for the group. Managing to do a fairly large sum of damage to him before his turn came about and power glowing orbs flew off from him, disappearing into the mist. Their varied colors the 3 Primary Colors (Red, Green, and Blue) and 3 Secondary Colors (Cyan, Yellow, and Purple) of the Power Crystal Spectrum. Further, he seemed to radiate an aura of ${"content":"Psychic","class":"rs-orange"}$ damage that quickly knocked ${"content":"Orla","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ unconscious and left ${"content":"Torinn","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and ${"content":"Xylaris","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ very hurt. Shifting their focus to the floating orbs, they noted two key events; The ${"content":"Blue Sphere","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ waivered when ${"content":"Xylaris","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ struck it with a thrown ${"content":"Flame Dagger of Returning","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and the ${"content":"Green Sphere","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ had some kind of surge that healed the guardian when ${"content":"Natty","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ struck it with one of ${"content":"Lucera","class":"rs-darkorange"}$'s magical bolts.

Fighting themselves on tightropes, they inquired with the forgiving guardian who noted that while they may fear their lives are in jeopardy, they were not and he allowed them to yield to the gaurdian. With the ritual ended, he began to leave, being convinced to answer 2 questions of the group's as he began to seek a new position at which to offer his challenge. From their inquiry they learned the guardian's name as ${"content":"Guarvello","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and that he noted they may want to seek out ${"content":"Reykurax","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ to further their understandings. Waking from their defeat, they found themselves exhausted and barely conscious. The warmth from ${"content":"Orla","class":"rs-darkorange"}$'s stones keeping them safe from the cold.

Looking around the barren tundra for shelter, ${"content":"Torinn","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ created a ${"content":"Tiny Hut","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and they slept through the night inside, protected from the chilling winds. With the coming of the morning, they snuck through the deep snow and made it back to the boat, managing to avoid the ${"content":"Orcs","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ that were patroling the land.

Back aborad the ${"content":"Sorafin","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, they discussed their next steps and paid their crew. Their next best option seeming to be a hunt for ${"content":"Qua Silverborn","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ in northern ${"content":"Lunderipio","class":"rs-darkorange"}$. Working out their route, they decided to stop by ${"content":"Racual","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ again first for more information and any additional supplies they may need. ${"content":"Norwind","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ checked the map and plotted a course and they set off for a course west of ${"content":"Claruthano","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, avoiding the pirates in the ${"content":"Termingin Sea","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

Seemingly half way to ${"content":"Racual","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, they foung themselves beset by a giant octopus on see a small ${"content":"Black Tophat","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ floating in the waters. As its tentacles lashed out  at and around the ship, leaks sprung in the lower deck and threatened to crush the ship and her rudder. Jumping to action, the crew managed to hold the ship and keep the lower deck in decent enough repair, ${"content":"Natty","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ managing the major repairs and spurring ${"content":"Voro","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and ${"content":"Aranza","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ forward. And while the rudder was damaged, ${"content":"Norwind","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ managed to drive the tentacle beneathe the ship down and away, protecting the ship's ability to steer and slightly helping ${"content":"Xylaris","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ to avoid death underwater as she irritated the creature into retreating. With a brief respite from the octopus's terror, ${"content":"Natty","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ noted that it was probably waiting to see if they were stuck or would eventually sink, but the ship was in good enoough shape to travel, if ever so slightly curved.

Slinking their way into the port of ${"content":"Racual","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, they docked and made better last minute repairs as ${"content":"Engram","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ sought out the local dock workers and arranged for a more robust repair job, noting it would take 200${"content":"G","class":"rs-yellow"}$ and 2 days to bring the ship up to snuff, and that he, ${"content":"Voro","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, and ${"content":"Aranza","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ would be able to handle it.

Heading into town, the group bought 2 rooms for 2 nights, negotiating a decent discount to 150${"content":"G","class":"rs-yellow"}$, to get them through the nights and enjoyed the complementary buffet that came with it.

Visiting the castle for more information, ${"content":"Torinn","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ recognized General ${"content":"Builteir","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ but didn't maange to reach him before being cut off by the guards for the room he had entered. They explained that the room was for a meeting with an envoy heading to ${"content":"Indium","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ for a political discussion, but couldn't disclose what it was or didn't know. They did however clarify that entrance to ${"content":"Indium","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ is currently restricted to only those with business local to ${"content":"Coneixager","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ or of a related political nature.

Leaving from there, they sought their previous political friend ${"content":"Inare Kuris","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, but he seemed to be part of the entourage being sent to ${"content":"Indium","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, or at least in the same room as the others. They did manage to happen upon a noblewoman who seemed a bit full of herself, but she noted that she thought ${"content":"Qua Silverborn","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ to be dead along with his entourage, but became convinced that the group was part of ${"content":"Qua","class":"rs-darkorange"}$'s entourage. As they left her, she seemed to be looking for someone of importance whose ear should could grab for more information.

They finished their time in the city, drinking and eating at the buffet and on their last day were confronted by a small well dressed gnome who meekly inquired about speaking to ${"content":"Orla","class":"rs-darkorange"}$. In a city with few gnomes, he took a keen interest in ${"content":"Orla","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ after they stayed for 2 nights and thought maybe she was there to stay but ${"content":"Orla","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ had a small conversation with him none the less and learned that he, ${"content":"Umoro","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, was a local politico who helped the office manage political affairs with ${"content":"Leoterra","class":"rs-darkorange"}$. But in their shy conversing, ${"content":"Orla","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ didn't want to give her real name and in a bit of a fluster gave her name as ${"content":"Snackerbockle","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, which he seemed to find slightly questionable but left it and thanked her for her time, hoping to see her again some day.

Though, as the group watched over their small friend, they found ${"content":"Natty","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ slightly distracted by a small stray black cat that had curled up around her leg. As ${"content":"Orla","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ returned to the group, the small cat, now named ${"content":"Oh","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, had made herself at home in ${"content":"Natty","class":"rs-darkorange"}$'s lap and the pair seemed as happy as clam.

Two days of repair now past, the group set off back to the dock to find their crew wrapping up. ${"content":"Engram","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ noting that while he's pretty sure all the ale is still accounted for, that someone else may want to double check as he wasn't quite keeping tabs on the inventory, but they found everything to be in order. Settling back in and checking all the riggings, ${"content":"Oh","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ quickly made herself at home, chasing the ship's rats and elicting a happy chuckle from ${"content":"Engram","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ as he laughed and was happy to see that something might finally catch that rat as though it had been his nemisis while they were gone.

Setting out to sea in their freshly repaired ship, the ${"content":"Sorafin","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ sailed straight and true, making decent time towards the city of ${"content":"Intis","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ where they had learned ${"content":"Qua","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ had likely been. Though their trip was distrought by a new discovery of a ${"content":"Giant Whirlpool","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, seemingly 10 miles across, and also seemingly in the same place as the large flash they had witnessed many moons ago. Adjusting their course, they gave a wide berth to the new anomaly, staying a few miles out from its edge to avoid the currents, ${"content":"Torinn","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ updating their maps accordingly with his ${"content":"Cartography's Kit","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

Almost a week later, they found themselves off the frigid shores of ${"content":"Intis","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and took ${"content":"Norwind's Folly","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ out to the coast as the city has no dock. On arriving, they sought out a near by local old man who seemed to almost have a heart attack trying to run from them. Talking to him, they learned that the city is mostly populated by researchers and those seeking isolation, bringing almost no visitors, and the last group to visit brought violence with them. Inquiring however, the old man seemed reluctant to talk and mentioned that the Inn is likely where they'd like to head.

Reaching the ${"content":"Finyelela Inn","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, they spoke with the lithe Elven Inn keeper ${"content":"Areachei","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, who noted that the small town had indeed had visitors several months ago and that the events essentially culminated in them heading south. Partaking of some of the free rations and thanking her, the group set off south, but not before ${"content":"Orla","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ burrowed the lone book on the coffee table that no one seemed to want. ${"content":"Areachei","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ noted that the book had been there for several months and welcomed the small gnome to keep it if she'd like.

Heading south, they followed the path through the mountains, keeping an eye open for anything unusual...

export.name: Sailboat Captain
export.description:
You've learned to captain a sailboat from ${"content":"Po","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, allowing you to smoothly sail the open seas.

You know that a different sizes of ships have different desired crews.

# Small Sailing Vessels

These require very few crew to operate but only hold a small amount.
+ Generally not recommended for sailing on the open seas
+ 1 to 2 Crew to operate
+ General max of 4 people actively working the rigging
+ Up to 8 people on the ship

# Medium Sailing Vessels

This is where most boats from ${"content":"Draconia","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ fall.
+ Minimum crew of 3 to operate
     + Works well enough in coastal waters
+ Optimum operation begins at 5 crew, particularly on the open seas
+ Works best with 8 crew, and comfortably with 10
+ Can generally carry up to 25 people on board

# Large Sailing Vessels

Many of this class sail under the flag of ${"content":"Nautregno", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$. And while other nations have them as well, they typically serving as flagships in those cases.
+ Minimum crew of 15
+ Works best with a crew of 30
+ Can generally carry up to 80 people on board

export.name: Rescue the Envoy Qua Silverborn
export.description: While in ${"content":"Racual","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, you learned that ${"content":"Qua Silverborn","class":"rs-darkorange"}$'s entourage had been killed, despite your warnings, and that he was now likely hiding somewhere in northern ${"content":"Lunderipio","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, probably starting somewhere in ${"content":"Intis","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

export.name: Suspected location of Eva's'ar
export.description: You have an idea of where an ancient storage vault is located along the eastern coast of ${"content":"Lunderipio","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ where the ancient ritual dagger ${"content":"Eva's'ar","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ is likely resting.

export.name: City of Montis
export.description: Montis is the capital of Leoterra and a large port city.

export.name: City of Dranous
export.description: The City of Dranous is the capital of Draconia. Its port serves the military, the public, and private organizations.
export.note: Raven is based here.

export.name: Travels: The Imperial Gala
export.description: Taking some more time in the city of ${"content":"Tebit","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ before heading to ${"content":"Hwand","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, ${"content":"Eldith","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ headed for the ${"content":"Arcane Society's Library","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ as the rest of the party headed for ${"content":"Via's Smithery","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ for a bit more information on ${"content":"Hwand","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ before they head there. Shifting through the library, ${"content":"Eldith","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ remembered the wraith that follows acolytes into the library, watching over their access. Attempting to sneak around, she found the wraith too attentive to avoid and decided to venture out from the books. On her way out, she stopped to talk to ${"content":"Penea","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ regarding her research and learned that ${"content":"Indium","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ may hold more information on the ${"content":"Wyrm Beans","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ that she is studying. As their compatriot dug through bookshelves, the rest of the group got some answers from ${"content":"Via","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, learning that their future destination was on the edge of ${"content":"Dragon Territory","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and usual over run by wildlife and a practice hunting ground for younger dragons. But because of this, there are a number of artifacts lost in ${"content":"Hwand","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ as few have managed to retrieve them. Wandering around the city and asking a few more questions the group also learned that dragon slaying specialty equipment is quite expensive and getting some more information on a fugitive researcher by the name of ${"content":"Sinda","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ for attempting to murder an acolyte and steal his ${"content":"Veldyr Statue","class":"rs-darkorange"}$. Discussing their next destination on the boat, they decided against ${"content":"Hwand","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ for now, deciding it to be too dangerous and instead set a course for ${"content":"Dranous","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, hoping to acquire more gear and skills from the stores and the library and then planning where to head next from there. Sailing the open sea, they spent their time mostly reading and relaxing, but ${"content":"Ginnet","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and ${"content":"Lucy","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ took to experimenting with the ${"content":"Poison Leaves","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and ${"content":"Alchemy Ingredients","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ they had around. When a potion seemed to fail, they tried to experiment on the "local" rat population and at one point ${"content":"Ginnet","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ accidentally chased one and slid off the boat. Quickly recovered, though a bit wet, they set about attempting it again and finding another rat, this time ${"content":"Lucy","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ managing to catch one. Confining it and with a bit of coercion, they didn't manage to get it to try to liquid, but it did avoid it, leading the pair to dub their concoction ${"content":"Rodious Repelous","class":"rs-darkorange"}$. Reaching ${"content":"Dranous","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, they made their way to the library, planning to visit the ${"content":"Quartermaster","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, then ${"content":"Lar","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ after that. The city proved guarded yet festive. More patrols were around the city and banners hung in several places announcing and celebrating the coming ${"content":"Imperial Expedition Gala","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ that seemed to be being held at the ${"content":"Imperial Library","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ sometime the next day. At the library, they couldn't find their acquaintance ${"content":"Horus","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ but found that the front desk had their books; ${"content":"Nature of the Power Crystals","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, and ${"content":"The Basics of Alchemy","class":"rs-darkorange"}$. Inquiring a bit, they learned that many of the librarians were out or busy due to the Gala, but the library was still open for people to peruse. Books in hand, their next stop was the ${"content":"Quartermaster","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, where they found their old friend ${"content":"Cravous","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ back in action. Paid and looking about, they found ${"content":"Ginnet's Carriage","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ freshly cleaned and sparkling curdesy of the ${"content":"4th Division","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ as punishment for something the quartermaster opted not to repeat. Walking to the castle, they were taken to visit ${"content":"Lar","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ as usual and caught a glimpse of another of ${"content":"Lar","class":"rs-darkorange"}$'s teams before their meeting with him. Catching him up on their activities, they learned 2 things: + An ${"content":"Assassin","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ is in the city that is after two librarians, but he noted that another team was already handling that as well as additional security. + ${"content":"Po","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, ${"content":"Vo","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, and ${"content":"Anna","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ are being recalled for special operations looking into the ${"content":"Assassin","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ + The next day, ${"content":"Po","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ will train someone in ${"content":"Sailboat Captaining","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and ${"content":"Anna","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ will train someone in ${"content":"Nautical Navigation","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ + The ${"content":"Scry","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ spell is in the ${"content":"Advanced Arcana Section","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ of the library + The recipe for ${"content":"Spell Ink","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ can be found lingering, semi-hidden in the section for ${"content":"Magical Plants and Applications of Leafs","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ ${"content":"Ash","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and ${"content":"Eldith","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ headed back to the library to searched for spells as the rest of the party went to scope ${"content":"Ixa's Bar","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and see what was going on with the festivities. Finding a few books on ${"content":"Evocation","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and ${"content":"Conjuration","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, as well as a book dedicated to ${"content":"Scry","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, the ${"content":"Ash","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ slowly browsed as the smaller dwarf scurried about the library between all the decorating, copying spells and the alchemy recipe she managed to find. Meanwhile at the bar, ${"content":"Ginnet","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and ${"content":"Lucy","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ read as ${"content":"Quincy","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ caught up on his drinking, enjoying the seemingly limitless booze of the capital city. After meeting up, ${"content":"Eldith","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ passed the ${"content":"Spell Ink","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ recipe along to the party alchemist pair as ${"content":"Ash","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ drank himself into a nap whilest ${"content":"Ginnet","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ schemed to work his way into an expedition for some coin. A bit of deceit and a sly casting of ${"content":"Friends","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ earned ${"content":"Ginnet","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ some information about the ${"content":"Gala","class":"rs-darkorange"}$; Namely that there's a 500G registration fee due by ${"content":"4","class":"rs-lightblue"}$th ${"content":"of Borgevum","class":"rs-lightblue"}$, the usual payout for an expedition is 10 to 20 thousand gold, and the people hiring and the expedition groups are very discrete, only hire those who have been vetted by the library. Finishing their night out, the group slept aboard the boat and when they woke, ${"content":"Eldith","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ set about attempting to ${"content":"Scry","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ on ${"content":"Inrena","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, but her attempt failed as she resisted being targeted by the spell. Distraught but not defeated, the group headed to the castle to train and inquire about ${"content":"Teleportation Circles","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ in the city. And as ${"content":"Ginnet","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ was taught the basics of captaining and ${"content":"Lucy","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ the basics of navigation, the rest sought out the ${"content":"Teleportation Circle in the Dranous Barracks","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ to get familiar with it should they ever need to cast a circle of their own to travel here, and to the ${"content":"Quartermaster","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ to hire two crew from the ${"content":"Draconian Army","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ as that was all the soldiers that could be spared, but would cost 50G a month to pay them. Speaking with ${"content":"Cravous","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, they hired a hard headed but potentially skilled Elven ranger by the name of ${"content":"Cramini Fijar","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, and a stout fun loving dwarf by the name of ${"content":"Gromaxe Dindle","class":"rs-darkorange"}$. As they met up to finish their training and debrief, speaking briefly with ${"content":"Lar","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, they inquired about additional crew as having a few around to maintain the boat and give them some free time at sea was desired. ${"content":"Lar","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ noted that more crew could be hired and recommended ${"content":"Montis","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ for general access to sailors looking for work, and that generally ${"content":"Tertiusa","class":"rs-darkorange"}$'s fighting ring is good for earning the respect of a sailor or 2 who may serve for a cut of what's found or at least volunteer to join if there's a decent enough showing in the ring. Taking their information in, they pondered their next move and the next day to try ${"content":"Scrying","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ on ${"content":"Inrena","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ once more...

export.name: Quest: Nobles of Ascaqua
export.description: On the 18th of Unkulevum in 317, the city of Ascaqua fell to a seeming legion of Snakes. The mighty walls being torn down, but the snakes were repelled, driven back by the Draconian military and special forces, saving the town from complete destruction. And while the buildings outside the walls and a few inside were reduced to rubble, the Reimanzi Vicus District remained untouched, but stood barren of any people save 2 children and a cat. There, you learned that the people there had been kidnapped by Orcs and that they had managed to hide. Being children, they were also probably not considered worth the effort even if they had been found, though the cat seemed a bit protective itself. While the children and the stray cat they said had been with them were dropped off in Dranous, the rest of the inhabitants of that district remain to be found.
export.note: Session 16 for the fall of Ascaqua

export.name: Alchemy: Rodious Repellous
export.description:
You know how to brew ${"content":"Rodious Repellous","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

${"content":"Alchemy Kit","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ DC${2,orange}$:
+ 1 ${"content":"Poison Leaf","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ 1 ${"content":"Alchemy Ingredient Bundle","class":"rs-darkorange"}$

export.name: Imperial Gala
export.description: A yearly event that falls on the 5th of Skaparvum Held by the the Imperial Library in Dranous, skilled expedition teams and high profile organizers, such as the library itself, meet to discuss important and lucrative contracts. These contracts are usually known to range from 10 to 20 thousand gold, depending on needs for secrecy and possible dangers. Access to the event is typically heavily restricted, and the Draconian Army has always provided protection. Before the event, by 5th of Borgevum, expedition teams and organizers must be registered and have paid the 500G fee. Once paid, background checks are conducted to ensure that everyone's major claims are at least largely true. The event itself, is almost a large festival in the city, lots parties and drinking go on around town as other teams not in the Gala come by to join, usual securing their own smaller deals elsewhere in the city over the few days around the Gala itself.

export.name: Rats
export.description: Simple in their motivations, they can occasionally be useful with training, or be another's friend. They can also be quite vicious in some parts of the city or the wild, but will usual try to avoid confrontation.

export.name: Raven
export.description: Surprisingly complex creatures, their motivations remain fairly simple. Can make an excellent ally or an annoying pest.

export.name: Snake
export.description: Dangerous to the untrained, particularly its large cousins, the smaller more common snake's main feature is it's venom. Otherwise, it is fairly harmless to the experienced.

export.name: Spider
export.description: Dangerous to the untrained, particularly its large cousins, these spiders usually merely want food and may ignore anything not threatening it. Their main feature is their venom. Otherwise, it is fairly harmless to the experienced.

export.name: Arcane Society Library
export.description: The central library on arcane practices and teachings, it is constantly added to by the researchers in and from Tebit. Security in and around the library is considered one of the best in the world considering that Tebit itself has no formal standing army or city walls like that of the Cortex Centurium in Indium or the Imperial Library in Dranous. And while the collection within is vast, it is almost entirely on magical elements of the world, so things such as history or political treatises are not found here-in. Additionally, access is granted only to members. Acolytes receiving access to works within their realm of research, with that access growing as the rank increases. Few have spoken outwardly about what the extent of the defenses within are, but many at least know that a seemingly haunting wraith follows everyone who enters. If seeking access, speaking with the head of the society, Penea Entell, is where one should start.

export.name: Power Crystals: Arcane Formation
export.description: Intricate power circles can be formed around ones arm with 2 or more Power Crystals to create an Arcane Formation that empowers the spells cast by the creature. This usually applies to red, Green, and Blue crystals but all colors can be used with the appropriate skill and knowledge. For higher level spells, these formations tend to be required as well as needing to be sufficient level and knowing the spell. To create a formation, you must know the incantations for the crystal to use as well as Ancient to speak them properly and make the necessary adjustments. The crystals used give the formation its power also give it a hue. If all crystals are of the same type, you'd get a Red, Green, or Blue hue. If there are mixed types, you'd receive a Purple, Yellow, or Cyan hue normally but if all types are used in equal portions you'd have a white hue and formations of 6 or more with a white glow are considered a Halo. The more powerful crystals such as Lime, Orange, Silver, and Gold complicate the formation, making it more difficult to maintain, but can exponentially increase the power. Other variations of the crystals exist as well, corruption, divinity, transcendence, and other effects may be present on a crystal and effect the way that it interacts with the formation.
export.note:
Lime can serve as red, green, or blue

Orange acts as a power enhancer (think doubler)

Silver allows cross planar actions

Gold is essentially godlike in a formation but hilariously difficult to use.

export.name: The Inkanti-olo
export.description: A humble and rarely seen religious sect of the Wood Elves, these Cat Worshipers live in the woods, occasionally amongst larger felines such as panthers and tigers. Known for the ability to communicate with cats without words, they have made a number of spells and items that attune the holder with nature. The most noted part of them is their connection with the Veldyr, some of the few humanoid creatures known to interact with wild ones peacefully.

export.name: Ancient Dragons
export.description:
Older and tending toward having a place they have settled, they tend to desire an isolated life, venturing out only occasionally to add to what is likely a large collection.

As with other ages, they are not known to nestle with other dragons, and at this age are not known to seek out mates, though it likely occurs.

export.name: Young Dragons
export.description:
Tend to be found exploring the most and most free willed. While they can occasionally be found with other dragons, this seems to be largely for learning purposes as they do not seem to build bonds of friendship, merely respect.

While the young ones explore the most, many dragons

export.name: Ancient Information in Reykurax
export.description: You've learned of the Realm Reykurax from the Guardian Guarvello. He recommended that the lost spirits of the dead there may offer information for learning Ancient, or at least the more powerful wizards that visit.

export.name: Recover the Blade
export.description: You know that something has stolen the Blade of Mist from the Tomb of Arcar where it had been hidden. Investigating with Navigation and the Compass of Ambition has revealed that something is in possession it and was at least somewhere on the West side of Sulendirida.

export.name: Draconian General Builteir
export.description: Responsible for leading and managing army divisions within Calokula. You met him in Neulus Re while hading to Simer shortly after retrieving the Blade of Mist.

export.name: Emblem: Coneixager
Emblem: Draconia
Cover: Deliver Books to Indium
export.description: Speaking with Lar, he was easily able to obtain papers of entry to Indium for you under the cover of delivering books to the library there, The Cortex. The papers grant 48 hour access and will limit activity to around that library, but exploring should be fine.

export.name: Teleportation Circle: Vefsioni
export.description: You know the runic sigils to reach the Teleportation Circle in the city of Vefsioni in the Realm of the Dead. This enables you to reach it with the Plane Shift Spell spell when you are on a different plane, or with Teleportation Circle should you be in the same realm.

export.name: Teleportation Circle: Stjornu
export.description: You know the runic sigils to reach the Teleportation Circle in the city of Stjornu in the Realm of the Dead. This enables you to reach it with the Plane Shift Spell spell when you are on a different plane, or with Teleportation Circle should you be in the same realm. The circle is notably hidden just beneath the stone flooring to keep it secret.

export.name: War on Leoterra
export.description: Nautregno has declared war on Leoterra. Politically, this has been decreed as a war over sovereignty of the northern islands as well as Druteta and Basel.

export.name: Nation of Leoterra
export.description: Leoterra was founded on the continent of Mikillabellera and soon expanded to Lunderipio. Composed mainly of Humans, Gnomes, Halflings, and Dwaves, it is ruled as a Republic out of Montis, with a group of every race, including Elves, Dragonborn, and others, serving to help make decisions for the nation.

export.name: Nation of Nautregno
export.description: Nautregno was founded on the continent of Lurus through many wars. Other races used to live here but were forced out or killed by the Orcs. Composed mainly of Orcs, some Half-Orcs are known to reside here as well a other races that are kept as slaves to an elite few Orcs. Any non-Orcs found inside Nautregno's borders are generally hunted down to capture or kill.

export.name: Nation of Draconia
export.description: Draconia was founded on the continent of Calokula where it was once over-run by magical creatures. Composed mainly of Dragonborn, many other races can be found here, including demons and beings from other realms, though much less common. It is ruled by Queen Soleina Altandor, from within the city of Dranous. Food and other sustenance are generally free within the nation's borders, even to outsiders. The nation's generosity and care have earned it a position of trustworthiness with the other nations and the Power Crystals that the nation produces lead to at least respect from trading. A respect that the Queen tries very hard not to monopolize.

export.name: Nation of Conexiager
export.description: Conexiagerwas founded on the continent of Turrija. The land being mostly of plains and trees, it was and remains quite peaceful. Composed mainly of Elves, very few other races are found here outside of the political district of Ulwazora or its capitol of Indium. Much of the populace have dedicated themselves to peace and knowledge and the powerful wizards through its people have easily driven off many attempts to invade or conquer the nation, mostly from Nautregno or Pirates attempting to steal parts of the nation's history or knowledge.

export.name: Travels: The Singed Hand
export.description: As they ventured south in search of the lost Ambassador Qua Silverborn, they looked for tracks and followed Xylaris and Norwind as they followed several tracks in the soft snow. Following the trail for a few days with a Snow Storm slowly approaching, they found small groups of dead bodies that kept them on track, running into a couple of guards on the side of a mountain, they met Orvern and Velinqu that were trying to find Qua themselves. Getting filled in on the past situation from the new pair of guards, they learned that the bodies they had followed were from assassins chasing down Qua's guards and the guards themselves. Looking around, the group had also spotted a pair of dead bodies by a cave, which Orvern and Velinqu confirmed as where they suspected Qua was hiding, but didn't feel they were enouogh to deal with whatever might be in the cave hunting or holding Qua. Their new friends brought up the rear as the rest of the group pushed forward, following a trail of blood along the rocky walls. Reaching the end of a tunnel, they were confronted with a crazed guard seemingly next to a corpse, and after some failed negotiations, managed to jump and restrain him. Their new friends helping to identify the corpse as Qua and found a note of some kind on his person. Torinn discussing the note with the other guards, collectively agreed that the note should remain on with the body, on which Torinn had cast Gentle Repose to keep it from decaying. The other guard that they subdued was no longer crazed but had passed out after being revived by Torinn. As a precaution, the group tied him up and they all started to head back to town, setting up for the first night's camp a few miles north, the Snow Storm settling in overhead as the buried Qua's dead body in the snow to help preserve it. As they slept, the subdued guard woke in the middle of the night, screaming from finding himself unable to move. His screams seemed to wake the everyone in the group except Orla, who was quite soundly asleep. Even Orvern ventured over to see what the screaming was about. Speeaking with the now concious guard, he could not remember anything, but while he could not remember anything he was agreeable enough to being captured just confused and initially overwhelmed. As they all started to leave the tent, a subtle orange glow caught their eye from where Qua's body had been buried. As they moved to investigate, Xylaris was stabbed in the back by Orvern as the others realized that Qua's body was being melted by lava, Norwind quickly rushing toward the melting body and fishing out a Hand. Meanwhile, the others dispatched Orvern, his body quickly decaying and oozing out as he passed away, specs of black tar reminiscent of the Cthulhian Acolytes littered his organs. As Torinn went to cast Revivify, he found the body to have been dead far too long to be revived. Torinn stayed to watch over their captured guard, who acknowledging his perdictament and remained content with staying in the groups care as they hadn't hurt or injured him to his recollection and seemed to be treating him nicely enough considering. Taking a moment to raise a skeleton construct from Orvern's corpse and naming it Zule the First. The rest of the group gave chase to Velinqu, who was presumably the one responsible for melting Qua's corpse. Following a faint trail, they found that their foe had managed to give them the slip, but after carefully back tracking their steps, they found him again and resumed their pursuit, easily finding him around a severl cliff sides by a Faint Orange Glow that Orla worked out to be a spell of some kind but could not make out what spell. Ending his spell, their target slipped into the Snow Storm. Quickly investigating, Norwind was the first to get within range and managed to avoid several crossbow bolts before finding him in the snow. And after exchanging a few blows, Orla managed to land several spells from Hivern's back, destroying the assassin's body similar to his friends, the trio taking a moment to properly desecrate his corpse before the others arrived. Regrouping at camp, they packed up and resumed heading north. Along the way, they discussed the note they had seen on Qua's body and recalled that it mentioned something regarding the city of Intis. On their return to the city, they dropped their captured guard off with the body under the guard of the crew and Zule. Heading back into town, they asked around about Qua and searched his room with Areachei's permission. In the room they found a scroll written in some kind of code and asking around they learned that Qua had purchased several shovels and managed to unbury a trapped box that uses The Rising Dawn's Fang as a key to uncode the scroll they found. Reading the scroll, they learned that it contained the ingredients to a bomb that could render a Soul Stone inert, releasing the souls within to Reykurax and other realms of the afterlife or for rebirth. With their new information in hand, the group headed for Racual, where they took the captured guard to be treated. Meeting Dr. Oreleno, who restored their captee with Greater Restoration through several arcane power circles inscribed into the room, allowing it to act as an advanced healing chamber. Healed and in better health, the group learned his name to be Gloin and that he had some form of mentally imposed speech, with a tiny touch of crazy but seemed good enoough to keep around and was happy to join the Sorafin's crew for ${50,orange}$ gold a month, currently serving as a chef, keeping the crew's morale high with delicious food. Searching for more information on occurances around and wanting to get information about Qua to someone of imoprtance, they spoke with Inare, and after a bit of arguing with Torinn, the group decided to head back to Dranous to speak with Lar as Inare was unable to help with access to Indium. On their way to Dranous, the group took some time to meditate and paid the crew for a total of ${450,orange}$G. But also found that Gloin was able to easily fit in, easily persuaded into any shenanigans by Xylaris, Natty, or even Torinn as the group set about acting out small pranks. Arriving at Dranous, the group set off to speak to Lar and they sent Voro off to get equipment for Gloin and Zule. Speaking with Lar, they brought him up to speed on their activity, informing him of Whaitiri and the Kintari. They also learned that they'll need to move to a fully independent operation as their ${1000,orange}$G payment today will be their last payment for awhile, though their authorization to "burrow" from the production factory in Sa Brac still stands. A few important things they learned from Lar: + Po is retiring after the mission and Lar has the spell scribes to teach Po's special Hammock spell, which he handed over. + Resurrection is a nigh impossible feat for any of the wizards Lar knows, including Indium. Thus he left Qua's hand in their care to deal with getting additional information.
